comments: I've been taking this product for just over a week. The first night I took it at 8pm with dinner (as directed) and by 10pm, I'll be damned. I felt something start to bubble and fizz as soon as it hit (what I am assuming) is my small intestine because my stomach felt just fine. I can honestly say I believe these capsules do make it to the intestinal tract. I've also noticed the small trace of oral thrush I've been battling for months has also cleared up. It's definitely one of the best probiotic supplements I've ever taken.

They are very easy to swallow firstly and secondly, unlike a lot of other probiotics I have taken, they do not nauseate me or cause gas.  Then, my pooch has flattened out a bit which leads me to the last bit and this might be TMI so beware, I know that they are working because I can see the candida that had clearly overgrown in me hence the bloat floating in the bowel after each elimination.  That is the one thing that I always look for in a probiotic because it shows me that the bacteria are alive and in fighting spirit and for the first time in a very long time, I found that one thing in this line so, I will be sticking with it :)

I am currently battling breast cancer and Chrons Disease, and unfortunately, I seem to get every illness that comes around. I started taking this a couple of months ago and have already noticed an improvement. I still have gotten sick a couple of times, but I do believe that it lasted a shorter time and that it wasn't as bad as usual. I have a very sensitive stomach, so I do take it with a few crackers or a glass of milk... and be prepared.... the pills are BIG and although the smell is ginger and "something else"... the "something else" stinks..LOL (totally worth it) I also feel like I have more energy, too.  I am definitely going to continue to keep this is my daily routine. Received in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion

What I like most about this product is that it is delivered through the intestines & that is the best way to receive a Probiotic. I have a low immune system due to an autoimmune disorder, so I am always sick....& I hate it! I am taking these to support my immune system, so I hopefully get less illnesses. So far, so good....I already feel less bloated around my gut area after taking these for a week. These are also helping me to become more regular. I really am impressed with the fact that this supplement is vegetarian friendly & also made in the USA! My family is a proud supporter of all products made here @ home. I received this supplement @ no cost in exchange for my honest, unbiased opinion.

I have been taking probiotics for sometime now but when I was offered this bottle of Optimum Probiotics: Deep Immune System Support during a promotion for my honest review my curiosity would not let me say no.
They arrived very quickly, were sealed very well and were not damaged.
These are very easy to swallow, they have no nasty after taste and they do not upset my sensitive stomach at all.
These are delay release so they do not get absorbed till they are deep down where they need to be which is great.
After just 2 days they already had my stomach working regular and hopefully I will get sick less often,
My family is testing several of these products this month, we are impressed with all of them so far.

comments:
I would give this 5 stars but the only thing holding me back is the taste. I got this for my 4-year-old daughter who has MTHFR and needs this form of folate, and she does not like it as much as other multi-vitamins she has had - she says it's too "spicy." It does have a stronger taste. I believe the maker is trying to cut back on the excess sugar you see in many vitamins, which is great, but perhaps a children's version that tasted more palatable (I'd be fine with more sugar!) should be the next product formulation.

  My sister was tested recently discovering she was homozygous for C677T mutation.  Being homozygous, I figured I probably shared at least one copy of the mutation. I seem to have trouble metabolizing certain foods and have always had issues taking folic acid.  Regular vitamins, even when taken with food, cause nausea and gas/bloating.  I am also easily dehydrated experiencing cottonmouth with the slightest caffeine or alcohol consumption.  Since taking these new vitamins with "useable" nutrients, I've had none of the aformentioned issues.  I take one in the morning and one in the evening. Works well for me.

  The ingredients are really good. Its very hard to find a vitamin that has these active ingredients in them. I had hoped my children could take these but they taste really bad. They are a chalky consistency and very large. You are also supposed to take two and I couldn't even get one down them by them selves. They amused me and tried them many different ways since I told them they were good for them. I tried smashing them (they do smash really well and easily!) and hiding in pudding, applesauce and smoothies. I think smoothies would be a good bet for those that like smoothies, unfortunately, my kids don't care for them. I think a frosty would work too if you were willing to make that every time... in the end, they didn't work for us because they hated the taste. I ended up taking them myself so they would go to waste and it really gagged me every time, so honestly, they don't taste good. I hope this product can be made to taste better because we are in need of a tasty multivitamin with active B ingredients.

  I have a mthfr 1298c single mutation. It never caused issues for me. I decided to try a specialized vitamin just recently, when I had a severe health issue that turned out to be neurological Lyme disease. I find that when I take this vitamin, I feel better, think more clearly. No major vitamins contain the appropriate form of folate for me, wish I had been aware during pregnancy.

  Several members of my family take this supplement, with good benefit.  (MTHFR mutations run in my family.) This supplement is formulated in proportion (100-200% Daily Values).  This may be a reason why I feel magnitudes better on this than methyl folate or methyl cobalamine alone.
Elaine Fleming

  I was recently diagnosed as homozygous for the MTHFR gene and through a lot of online research I found this product line through Dr. Lynch.  I have always felt  as though I had some type of nutritional deficiency and now I have finally come to realize what it was.  I have been on this supplement for less than a week and my energy levels have gone up dramatically.  I am going to order additional products from Seeking Health, as the whole product line seems to be aligned with this particular genetic makeup.  I am optimistic that the anxiety, depression, moodiness, lack of energy, skin issues, etc. will all be resolved through this product line.  Please keep up all the helpful research you have done!

  I feel better with this vitamin then regular ones. I have MTHFR compound heterogeneous. The taste could be better. I take both at the same time, chew quickly and chase with water.

  The methylated folate really helps my son with SPD.  He also never complains about taking them.  These were recommended by his pediatrician.

comments: I purchased this for my daughter instead of the competing Sonicare kids product. My wife loves her Sonicare, but it does take some getting used to and I'm not sure my 4 year-old would have the patience.

This toothbrush is fine, although it needs more than one speed. It spins way too fast, which both hurts my daughter's mouth and creates a toothpaste-y mess. If they design it with a high *and* a low speed this product would fare much better. The bristles are noticeably softer than adult brushes, however.

The front of the package indicates it is appropriate for 8 year-olds and above, although the accompanying instructions simply say not to use it on kids under 3. If you're like me and tired of shelling out $7 a month on a disposable princess spin brush (the bristles never seem to hold up for a full 3 months), this and Sonicare are pretty much your only options for rechargeable kids brushes.

If you're child is 6 or 7 (or older) I would go with this product. If his/her mouth is tender/sensitive I would continue shelling out money for battery-powered spin brushes a couple more years. Or use this brush every third day and more gentle spin brushes the rest of the time.

We bought 2 of these brushes - one for each kid.  My children are actually pretty young.  4 and 6 yrs old but with a little instruction they are doing very well with these brushes.  The timer on the brushes has been working very well in telling them how long they should really be brushing.  We have had the brushes for several months now and they still work great.  Very pleased with this purchase

First of all, these clean your teeth far better than can be achieved with a manual brush. Using the Oral B has allowed me to go much longer between professional cleanings. Secondly it is a durable and reliable product. Typically I get three or four years out of one of these before water gets inside or the battery starts getting weak. The last one I used so much I wore a hole through the rubber over the switch. Several months later enough water had gotten in to corrode the motor. Sometimes I just replace one because it gets ugly. When the batteries are new I can go on two week camping trips without a charging. I bought this one because the battery in my old one had weakened to the point of only lasting three days off the charger. Braun builds a quality tooth brush that is well worth the money.
PS The cheapest power head, such as this one is built just as well as the expensive models.

It appears to be well made and my daughter does enjoy using it. The description is somewhat misleading. It states that it comes with  two refill heads. There is only 2 total, not 2 extras. Still a good buy.

I purchased this because it was a bit cheaper than what seemed like the equivalent adult toothbrush.  Now that i have it, it seems to work the same as the one I'd had (which stopped charging) and the one my husband still has.  The only differences we've noticed:
- Looks different ... the colors / pattern
- Doesn't have a blinking light to show it's charging
- Came with a soft-head toothbrush

I think it's a great toothbrush, just like all my previous Oral-B toothbrushes.  We've been using them for many years - they don't last for ever.  For us, the batteries always eventually stop charging sufficiently. But we don't expect rechargeable batteries to last forever.  So we are very happy with all our Oral-B toothbrushes, this one included.

My Nala had been limping,struggled to get up on her couch and not carrying her ball around (she always had her ball wherever she went) and showed no interest in playing with her brother. This was very sad and it seemed to only be getting worse, after many visits to the vet they gave her cortisone shots and that was only a temporary fix. After filling scrips and reading the other medicine side affects I became more worried for her. So a friend told me to check this out. (Skeptical but Desperate ) They've now been on it over a month, 3 tsp a day and it seems to be working, although not perfect she has her ball back in her mouth and wants to play again. (going easy) So for me its been a great improvement and will continue giving it to them hoping to see more relief. I sure missed seeing them wrestle/play and her wonderful spirit seems to be coming back:).
 I'm onto my 2nd bottle and will continue giving this to them.

comments:
I love this Clean Cinnamon Pro-Health toothpaste from Crest (The toothpaste itself is what I rate 5 stars).  I would give Amazon 1 star for their pricing of it, though.  I can only get it online, probably because it is not the most popular with many people.  Anyway, the price has been steadily rising on Amazon (as have the prices on almost all of their goods), and of note the prices of Amazon-fulfilled, Prime-eligible options are INFLATED!  This toothpaste has inflated to $5.24 per 6oz tube. Ridiculous!  It is currently available on the Proctor and Gamble eStore for $4.00 per 6oz tube, and they offer free shipping if you buy more than $25 worth of goods (which is 7 tubes).  This price beats the best available price on Amazon by $1.24 per tube for Amazon Prime members!

  While I did initially like this product I did came across some research showing that the tiny beads in this are actually plastic.  And that when we spit it out into the sink the beads are getting into our water supply and causing harm to the environment and fish.  To me the beads aren't worth it.  They don't seem to add much to the paste so I will buy something else.

  I misinterpreted the description and thought that it was a twin-pack of 11.6 oz tubes.  It's really 2 5.8 oz. tubes.  It's too much of a pain to return, so I'll keep it but I will NOT be purchasing toothpaste online again.
As far as the Crest goes, this is my absolute favorite toothpaste.  I prefer it above all others, the product is great!  I'll just be purchasing it locally instead of here, it's a better deal.

  I have been using this product for about a month now and I have noticed a difference in the degree of sensitivity of my teeth.  They are still sensitive, but cold water is not quite as painful as it used to be.  I am hopeful that regular continued use of this product will make a substantial difference in the sensitivity of my teeth.  At this stage, after using the product over a month, I definitely give it a thumbs up!

  CONTAINS-polyethylene.
It’s  a plastic used in all kinds of things like garbage containers, grocery bags, bullet proof vests, even knee replacements … and now in toothpaste.
Walvaren said one brand appears to use the plastic microbeads more than others.
“Pretty much everyone was saying that they were using some form of Crest toothpaste,” Walraven said.
Dentist Justin Phillip said the microbeads shouldn’t be anywhere near your mouth.dentist
“They’ll trap bacteria in the gums which leads to gingivitis, and over time that infection moves from the gum into the bone that holds your teeth, and that becomes periodontal disease, Phillips said. “Periodontal disease is scary.”

  My husband was having regular pain as a result of sensitive teeth. His dentist recommended this toothpaste to help relieve sensitivity. After about one month of use, the sensitivity subsided completely. That was over a year ago. If we run out of the Crest Sensitive, and he uses my regular toothpaste, the pain returns almost immediately. I have this product shipped to us regularly using subscribe and save. It saves me money, and ensures we never run out.

  We have used the Clean Cinnamon Pro Health for years....for some reason, the stores in our area don't carry this flavor any longer.  They only carry the gel stuff which we don't care for.  The Clean Cinnamon is not a gel and thats why we like it.  We have to buy this online in order to get it.  Frankly, I don't get it.  Why don't the stores in Oklahoma carry Clean Cinnamon?  They did several years ago, now nothing but gel.  In any case, the wife and I like this so much, we buy it online in quantity so we don't run out.  You really must like a toothpaste to go to the trouble of buying it in bulk online, huh?

  My wife is very picky with toothpaste, this one isnt my favorite, but she loves it. she complains it's hard not to just eat it cause it's so good (weirdo). our local target carried it once, we tried it, then went back for a refill and they had stopped carrying it for some reason. so really glad we were able to find it online, and might have been even cheaper than at store, can't verify that though.

This is the choice of toothpaste for my husband.  Very hard to find in stores, and thought it was discontinued, but was so happy to find it on-line....and in a 6-pack!

  This is the only toothpaste that will work for me and I believe it is being phased out as it is hard to find in the stores. It's my favorite and does the job without causing any problems for my teeth sensitivity.

Excited to find it on Amazon with free shipping for when extra trips to the store are hard to fit in or you keep forgetting to add it to your list; however, the cost is almost double the Walmart price. As far as the product, thought, I am highly satisfied with it.

  favorite brand of toothpaste, and at this price plus subscribe and save you cannot beat it!  Awesome being able to use amazon for these types of purchases.

  I got this on sale with a coupon that Amazon periodically makes available. It works fine just like any other toothpaste that I've used in the past (Colgate and Arm & Hammer). The Crest's texture was noticeably different - it's a bit looser with what feels like small globules or particles in a somewhat thinner paste compared to what I've been used to. It's not a problem per se, just different. The only minor issue is the taste. It's minty, but tastes a bit too synthetic for me.
Overall, no problem and the active ingredients are comparable to other similar toothpastes.

  I used to use Colgate toothpaste, but switched to Crest Complete when I accidently bought the wrong kind one time. What a happy accident because I like the flavor of Crest better than Colgate.
As far as toothpastes go, there isn't really anything exceptional about this, but unless you're going to buy special toothpaste from your dentist, you're really not going to get anything "exceptional."
(Note: my mom is a dental hygienist, so I've been lucky to learn a lot about dental care)

  I am definitely a convert to Crest Pro-Health toothpaste. It uses more fluoride than regular toothpaste and has a sort of grainy texture that does a fantastic job cleaning the teeth and keeping surface stains off. It can take a little getting used to at first as it is definitely a stronger toothpaste than the typical stuff out there, but it works extremely well. Highly recommended!

comments:
I loved these cereal bars, but their new version is awful compared to the previous.  Before the outside was crumbly and had a nice taste and texture.  These new ones, the outside is made from a much finer flour and goes gummy in your mouth quickly.  They also reduced the amount of blueberry filling and pressed the bar into a different shape.  Health Valley has some nerve to not even note the change on the outside of the package anywhere.  It is NOT the same product as it was.

  Health Valley changed their Blueberry Cobbler bars. They are now smaller with less filling. I used to eat them almost every day for a snack, now I am looking elsewhere.

  I ordered the Blueberry Cobbler Bars based on their high Amazon rating and was so disappointed in them that I came back to see if I had missed something.  I discovered in the more recent reviews that users of the earlier version of this product agree that there has been a major change for the worse -- with no change in packaging.
IMHO, the current version tastes more like a fig bar:  it's virtually impossible to taste even a hint of blueberry flavor.  The filling's appearance locks exactly like a generic compressed brown fruit mash -- nothing like the juicy blueberry colored filling in the package photo.
I would not buy these again.  I recommend you not buy them the first time.

  Every time I have ordered something from amazon that was labeled as a 6 pack, it meant that there were 6 boxes, not 6 in the box. The original price on this was over 20 dollars, do these people think their stuff is that good? Or is this an intentional deception towards the customer? I think amazon needs to review these people. This so called "6 pack" went on sale, and being a poor individual who was given a gift card, I was glad to find such a wonderful deal. When I received the box today (I ordered 2 of the 6 pack which on most orders would have been 12 boxes) I wasn't sure if it was the right order because the box was small and light. When I opened the box, I was disheartened to find that there were only 2 boxes, with 6 bars each. HAD I NOT BEEN MISLED BY THIS COMPANY, I WOULD HAVE ORDERED SOMETHING I ALREADY KNEW I LIKED, AND NOT TAKEN A CHANCE ON A DIFFERENT COMPANY.
If you are looking to spend way more for way less, this is for you. If not, find another company to order from.

  I was looking for a blueberry breakfast bar.  I bought these to compare against Kellogg's Nutragrain blueberry bars.  These are definitely better.  These are a bit sweeter and the grain portion is a bit drier, but I actually find that to be a positive (you'd think drier would be worse, but the texture actually works well with the flavor).  The Nutragrain bars are a little softer, but the flavor isn't as good.
As another reviewer noted, the blueberry filling isn't quite as proportionally large as shown on the box cover, but I found it to be fine.  Smaller than shown, but not stingy.  And it actually tastes strongly of blueberry, too, which really is what counts.  Good buy.

  These bars are no longer truly organic, as they contain very highly processed "rapeseed oil" that is presented in the form of "canola oil".  There is no such organic plant as a "canola" plant.  The name "Canola" comes from a combining of Can (from Canada) and "ola" for oil.  And the label is very misleading.  Will not be buying any Health Valley Organics....

  These are really delicious and I love the blueberry.  However whenever I order them I invariably get a box mixed with apple bars.  I like apple too or I would have complained.  However if you order blueberry it seems to me that that is what you should get.

  These are fairly sweet, but not bad.The pictures are misleading, it shows thin crust and thick filling, its excactly the opposite, very thin filling and thick crust, its not bad but i think I will look elsewhere for a breakfast bar.

comments:
I've been diabetic(type 1) for over 25 years. My blood sugars, even though they aren't too bad, still bounce around all over the place. I have tried several different recommended things such as glucosamine and chondritin, but they have a tendency to raise my blood sugars, which defeats the purpose. After trying this product, my blood sugars not only ran more consistantly, they also ran lower. Even on the very first day of taking them! I'm on an insulin pump and I had to lower my basal rates twice, and am about to lower insulin to food ratio as well. They were consistently around the 60 range, before I lowered the insulin. Now they're in the 70-90 range, some a little lower. This product is wonderful and I would recommend it to anyone. There were some posts online about the product causing constipation. I wouldn't really worry about it. There was some noticeable difference the first couple days, but then it went away. If anything, I would say it probably regulates that, just like the blood sugars. I'm glad I tried the product and will definitely be interested to see if it will hold up long term.

We have been looking, for years, for a B-vitamin that we can tolerate. We have MTHFR polymorphisms in my family (where folic acid doesn't convert very well to folate, and it competes with folate in the body), so we can't use a regular multi with folic acid. On top of that, we seem to be sensitive to methylation (methyl B-12 seems to overwhelm us). We've also discovered sensitivity to the normal form of B6. Can you tell we're fun at parties??
That being said, Dr. Lynch has really done the MTHFR community (or for anyone who is really sensitive to drugs or vitamins) a huge favor in coming out with this product. It seems safe for those on restricted diets (no gluten, dairy, etc.). The pills are the type where you can actually open them and make the dose smaller if you have empty capsules at home (you can buy them for this purpose).
I've been taking these for three weeks and am very happy with how my body tolerates them. I tend toward overmethylation on methyl b-12 and methylfolate. No jittery feeling. Very nice. Another family member (who is likely undermethylated) indicated itching after taking them, possibly from the niacin, as it's not the no-flush form.

After she researched Amy Yasko and Dr. Lynch she has been on a path to recovery. Certainly, Dr. Lynch's work (of Seeking Health) has helped tremendously, and these vitamins are designed specifically for people with her health issues.
I also began taking Seeking Health vitamins and I noticed a pick-up in energy and I no longer need that afternoon nap which was almost mandatory to make it through the day. I now believe using the correct type of B Vitamins are essentially to thrive.
I have to comment on one interesting side note from taking these vitamins as well. I have naturally lost my taste for alcohol. I did not have a problem with it. I certainly enjoyed 2 or 3 glasses of wine or beer with dinner maybe 4 or 5 times per week. But taking B vitamins have eliminated my desire. Strange? It's the only thing that has changed in my diet.

  One of the guidelines for someone with the MTHFR gene defect is to avoid folic acid.  When it comes to B-vitamins, that's a challenge.  It's hard to find a quality B-complex vitamins without folic acid.  B-Minus leaves out folic acid which frees me up to take methylfolate.

  If you have methylation issues and need a specific type of folate or B12 then this is for you.  It doesn't contain either of those B vitamins so you can accommodate the dosage and type of the missing folate and B12 for your needs.

  This is a fabulous product! I do not think anyone else sells a B complex without folate or B-12. After doing 23andme genetic testing, found that I need certain B vitamins, but need to moderate my intake of folate and methyl donors. I also need to take Hydroxy B-12, which is not found in any B Complex (that I have looked for). This product allows me to customize my supplement plan without missing out on other vital B vitamins. I take B-Minus every other day and on the days I take it, I also add a few methyl donors like TMG and NAC as the niacin in B-Minus helps mop up the excess methyl donors in my system. Thank you for having this product available!

  B Minus is perfect for me. Because of genetic mutations, I need all the B vitamins in their active forms--especially, pyridoxine 5 phosphate and riboflavin 5 phosphate.  However, because I take methyl B12 by injection and can tolerate only small doses of methyl folate, no other B complex on the market works for me.  Before finding B minus, I had to take the 6 Bs individually!

My wish would be that is would offer a lower potency since the %daily value is a bit more than I wanted to take.  But I will buy it again!  Thank you "Seeking Health" for such a unique and high-quality offering!

comments:
The "original" Glide was made by (or used) Gore Tex material. The photo for this product showed the logo for Gore Tex. The product shipped was the product now marketed by Crest; no mention of Gore Tex. The Crest product is vastly inferior to the "original" Gore Tex.

  


  Why is a popular product, the best one in the world that it's customers would pay a premium to buy, stomped out by Crest?  Original Gore brand Glide was the best non-shredding floss out there. Crest's product - that lies and says this is the original glide - sheds just like any cheap brand.  Oh I miss strong floss that does not shred.

  Wow, I thought I was the only person with a resentment about dental floss. Guess not. I loved the old Glide, made by Gore (in Flagstaff, AZ). This is neither original Glide floss nor any good. I also very much miss the old Glide floss. Would appreciate referrals to any good, non-waxy, plain floss.

  The smooth coating is not excellent any more, showing a gradual decline over the past 2-3 years. The exterior can be called as "in between smooth and rough".
This applies to the 100 meter dispenser also.
My belief is that they are now selling it, on its past good reputation.

  There's really very little one can say about dental floss, but this is VERY smooth and VERY wide dental floss that gets between teeth amazingly well.  It's an absolute joy to use this floss.  I buy it in bulk, and then double up whenever I use it.  It's great.
And incidentally, there's no comparison between this stuff and the regular Glide dental floss.  That stuff is wide and just as shred-free, but this Comfort Plus version is much smoother and gentler on the teeth as I floss.
The only negative about this floss -- like other brands -- is that shortly before it runs out, it 'cuts itself off' in the container.  So, essentially, if you want to use the last couple yards of this floss, you have to take apart the dispenser.  Not a big deal, I guess.

  It is rather ridiculous how much this floss costs (over $3 per individual box!), but $18 on Amazon is the cheapest I could find. Despite the price, this stuff is worth it. However, I'll caution you that you won't be able to go back to any other brand after this one. If you handle using generic floss or the cheaper stuff, do it. Only if you're a floss snob or have a hard time flossing with other brands should you get this, there is no going back once you feel the difference. The sibling product, Oral-B Glide Pro-Health (without the Deep Clean suffix), is pretty good but somewhat thinner in width than the Deep Clean. As a result I don't think it grabs gunk as well and I definitely feel a difference in favor of the Deep Clean when sliding it between my teeth. The Cool Mint taste is great and very light.

  I have very tight contact between my teeth and have tried the shred resistant Glide, which just broke instead of shredding. This floss has more give to it so it doesn't snap as easily and I can ease it in between my back teeth without it breaking. And it's convenient to get it in 6 pack and put it everywhere (each bathroom, purses, etc).

I especially love how they massage the gum line while brushing. The brush head is a bit large so I suggest you look for this in the store before relying on a picture. I don't recommend this for children.

But I'm really glad I made that mistake. The first time I used it; the feel caught me off guard. The back of the head of the brush has nubs that act as a tongue cleaner/stimulator. Down both sides of the bristles are gum stimulators that feel great when your brushing. This style of brush has given me the longest use per brush by far, than any other. These are what I'll be using for the foreseeable future.

When I use other toothbrushes (like when traveling) I don't feel as if my teeth are clean until I get back to this toothbrush. There are probably powered toothbrushes that "work better" but for those who need (like I do) or prefer (as does my son) to use a manual toothbrush, this one is awesome.

PROs:
- How firm the bristles are. Not too firm to make my gums get cut or bleed but they are firm enough for me to feel that my teeth are clean after brushing

comments: I have slightly high blood pressure so my doctor originally recommended I take ProArgi~9 to see if it would knock a few points off to avoid having to take prescribed blood pressure medicine. Since that time, I have tried many of ProAgi~9's competitors in an attempt to find a product that has the same quality and level of L-Arginine (5000mg) & L-Citruline (1000mg) both of which are beneficial to reducing blood pressure among countess other benefits. Here are the results of my taste test:
ProArgi~9: Great fruity flavor. Very drinkable. One of the more expensive products = $50
L-Argine Plus Cardio Health: Also very good flavor and easy to drink. Cost = $40
Cardio~Juvenate: Flavor was not the best but drinkable. Cost = $40
Dalvaia L'Arginine: Disgustingly sweet. Very hard to get down. Would not recommend. Cost = $40

Now, based on a combination of price ($25), quality of ingredients and flavor, Cardio Heart Health by Doctor Recommended is my #1 pick. It has a cranberry juice flavor so it's more on the tart side (which I prefer) but just sweet enough, whereas most of the other products listed above have more of a Kool-Aid taste.

I have found Cardio Heart Health to be an excellent product for several reasons.  I have suffered with swollen ankles for the last few years and have tried several products to get relief.  Thought I would give Cardio Heart Health a try after reading the book, "No More Heart Disease" by Dr. Louis Ignarro.  In reading this book, I discovered that my swollen ankles could be due to my heart not working properly, not to mention that I also have a-fib.  After taking this product for just a few days, I noticed that my ankles were no longer swollen.  I thought it could be a coincidence; but this product has proven to be a godsend as my ankles look normal now (yes, I can see my ankle bones!).  I have been using this product only once a day, but intend to add one more time to see if I can get "rid" of a-fib.
Some of the other reasons that I like this product are:
1.  It contains all the necessary vits/mins plus other heart health ingredients like Hawthorne Berry.
2.  It is in my price range.
3.  It tastes like a sweet-tart cherry drink
4.  It is GMO free
5.  It contains real sugar (not a lot but enough to taste good) and not the unhealthy sugar substitute like splenda.
6.  It is gluten free.

I am thrilled to find a product that does what is designed to do---help the heart!  I will continue to purchase it.  One last point-- according to the book, the ingredients in this product would be beneficial to those people who suffer from peripheral neuropathy.

I discovered the benefits of the combination of L-Arginine and L-Citrulline a few months ago and actually started with another brand. While I am not a doctor, I did major in biochemistry and understand the heart healthy benefits of boosting your body's production of nitric oxide. I am assuming that if you are reading this, you do as well. While my prior brand and Cardio Heart Health both have additional, proprietary ingredients, but the bottom line is the two active ingredients are the most important. Taking that into account I couldn't see paying so much more for the other brand.

Almost immediately after I started using Cardio Heart Health I noticed that my vascularity had increased even over the initial boost I got from my first L-Arginine supplement. Now, my veins are prominent - in a good way - all day long which to me is a superficial sign that CHH is doing exactly what it is advertised to do. My blood pressure has dropped over 8 points as well. For the value and the results, I highly recommend Cardio Heart Health to anyone seeking to improve their overall cardiovascular health. 5 stars.

I have been using this product for about 3 weeks now and have experienced very good results. Having tried 3 other products from the Amazon site over the past year and a half I plan to stay with cardio Heart Health for several reasons.
The taste is good and this product is the one that mixes in water far better than any other I have tried.

The L-Arginine and L-Citrulline mix while being standard for such products does the job in the Nitric Oxide production department while the other added ingredients work synergistically for overall heart health. As one other poster here indicated I should be able to cut down on some of the other vitamin purchases that I make as they are already included in this product.
Last but certainly not least, the price for this product is almost half of what others are charging for similar offerings and Cardio Heart Health gives more product for the dollar spent.

I don't work for this company and I do have serious heart concerns so I'm really not at liberty to fabricate a story about this product. I would recommend this product to friends as I humbly recommend it to you.

I have been taking 5000 mg's of L Arginine with Citruline for almost 2 years.  My doctor recommended it to reduce blood pressure and for overall cardiovascular health.  I decided to try Cardio Heart Health simply because the brand my Doctor sells is more expensive and I have been trying to reduce my monthly supplement expenses.

I am totally happy with this Cardio Heart Health L Arginine.  It dissolves well, tastes good and as far as my blood pressure is concerned, I know it is a bona fide product supplying what it advertises.  This has the added benefit of the proprietary blend of ingredients all of which support healthy cardiovascular health.  I will be ordering this product from now on.

comments:
I've never bothered writing a review before, but after using this product I just had to.  Maybe there is someone out there like myself.  Arthritis in your hands, knees, & hips.  Sit for too long .... hard to get up and going.  Prop your feet up for a while ..... painful to get the knees bent down again.  Hard to sleep at night ..... have to keep turning frequently due to the hip pain.  Work in the yard ..... stiff as a board afterwards.  That's been me for about 15+ yrs, & getting progressively worse each year.
Happened to see the Iceland Health Joint Relief Advanced Formula, w/Omega 3; read about their strict mfg. regulations; and thought why not.
I kid you not ..... in a week to 10 days, thought I could tell a difference, but just decided it was wishful thinking.  It's now been three (3) weeks, and I am almost pain free.  My left thumb has even stopped slipping out of joint.  The knots on my fingers are shrinking.  I hardly need to turn, in bed, at night at all.  I can prop my feet up, as long as I want, & my knees do not get stiff.  I can sit for long lengths of time, get right up, and walk away easily.  I honestly cannot believe it.  It is definitely the best money this 59 yr old lady has spent in a long time.  My 87 yr old Mom & I live together, I work full time, and I keep up our 3 acre yard by myself, therefore I need all of the help I can get.  My only regret is that I didn't discover this sooner, but at least I found it now!  Just wanted to spread the word.

  


  I can now squat down and completely bend my knee for the first time in over a year.  The pain was so bad.  The doctor showed me my xray early signs of degenerative arthritis.  Now after 3 months of taking IH joint relief and I can bend my knee.  This product really works.  It is truly amazing, however, it does not work overnight it does take a few weeks.
I will continue to take this forever as there is no side effects at all.  Actually it makes you have a overall feeling of wellness which must be from the fish oil.  I love Iceland Health I could not spend the rest of my live on Advil and Aleve. Its a miracle.

  I was looking for Omega-3 supplements in a local pharmacy because omega-3 fatty acids can increase HDL levels. I will not know my HDL level till March 2009, but the pain I had in one of my toes is totally gone. I am so happy that I will continue using it daily.  I always thought I will have to live with this pain forever but the supplement is no less than a miracle for me. I highly recommend anyone suffering from joint pain to give it a try. You will thank me later.

  
How wonderful this product is!  Before I purchased this product, due to arthritis in my left knee I could not walk well at all, even falling a few times because of the pain.  I purchased this product because of a friends recommendation.  Wow what a difference.  I am back to walking, mowing, standing and whatever else I can do.  This product is just amazing and unbelievable.  Thanks and will not go a day without taking this product.

  I bought this for my mother who has arthritis. It has been 2 weeks and she is starting to feel some relief from the pain and gaining mobility in her wrists and hands.

  Ever since I began taking Iceland Health Joint Relief, I feel that I have had less pain and inflammation in my joints. I would def recommend this to everyone!

comments:
I first tried the pre-strung flossers when I started to strongly dislike the string floss that has to be wrapped so securely around one's fingers that one starts to see the blood in one's fingers constrict while using it!!! I tried floss picks from other companies and found either they don't work in my mouth, and/or their floss breaks and/or gets stuck in my teeth, both things I dislike intensely.  I've tried the angle floss picks and they won't work in my mouth. I don't like flosses that are "too thick" and don't fit between my teeth or ones that are "too thin" and fray or split when moving them between my teeth. Suddenly while writing this review I'm starting to feel a bit like Golidlocks but the floss on these floss picks IS "just right". These picks are perfect for me. They're packaged well, the package opens easily and importantly ALSO closes back up easily and securely. For every 30 count, maybe for one or two, the floss will split and you'll abort the flossing process and reach for another, but in any given package, you can therefore expect that 28 or 29 picks will function perfectly. This is a much better performance than other floss picks from other companies whose products I've purchased, where I've discard 3 or 4 in a row looking for one that doesn't break.

  Makes Flossing Easy!
I love these floss picks; have used this style for 3-4 years. I was happy to see they are the same as the Crest I have been using.
The shape & design of the picks makes reaching even difficult spots easy, & the smooth floss is great. Other picks have floss that seems like velcro - difficult to glide between your teeth!
I know that I floss like I should because this makes the job easy, & does a great job cleaning.

  I'm so happy to find these on Amazon after my local stores stopped carrying them. They have the perfect grip to use to floss between tightly spaced and crowded teeth. This sling-shot handle is unique and better for me than the handles that look like hacksaws.

  Flossing can be a real pain. I was never great at keeping up with it until I found this style Glide Floss Picks. Now I floss just about every day and it isn't a chore at all. I can't use regular floss string because trying to get two hands in my mouth to reach my back teeth is just ridiculous. The straight across style floss picks don't make it any easier to get to your back teeth, which are really the most difficult to deal with, because your cheeks are still in the way.
That is why these floss picks are great. The design of these Glide Floss Picks are perfect because it makes reaching your back teeth very easy going straight into your mouth, and not having to come in from the side where your cheeks are in the way. Since your front teeth are easy to reach, the design is still easy to use there. Basically this design works perfectly for all your teeth. If you haven't tried these, you should give them a shot, because it will make flossing so much easier to keep up with.
Please note, these Glide Floss Picks are sold on many different Amazon listings and in various quantities, so make sure to shop around for the best price.

  These are so simple to use, yet so hard to find!  When I found a six-pack I ordered them immediately.  I have some knock-offs and they are total crap so don't be fooled by imitators.  Let's face it: most people don't floss as much as we are supposed to.  Using traditional floss is difficult, awkward and sometimes painful.  The string cuts into your finger and it's hard to get to back teeth.  These flossers eliminate all of those concerns.  If you have these you WILL floss everyday because it is so flippin' simple you no longer have a good excuse not to.  Your dentist will praise you for having such lovely teeth and gums.

  I love these floss picks. Some of my teeth are very close together and I find that with string floss I end up cutting circulation off to my fingertips trying to pull the floss between my teeth. These are so much more convenient, and I love the additional 'pick' portion of these, which allows me to get food bits out of larger spaces at the gum line. They have no taste/scent and are pretty strong (i.e. they rarely break/tear during use, unlike string floss).  I wish they weren't so pricey, but you get what you pay for.  I keep a bag in my desk drawer at the office and another bag of these in the living room so I can floss while watching TV in the evenings.

  I actually like the mint flavored glide picks, but have purchased them at Costco and online with no luck on getting through a flossing without them breaking and using 2+ per floss.  The Glide Pro-Health Clinical picks have no flavor, but for some reason, are designed that they do not break.  I prefer the other Glide products because they fit easier between my teeth, but being pragmatic, I will purchase these now.

  I have one arm and so need these to floss. The floss is wide and smooth, and you can pinch the bottom together to effectively stretch and tighten the floss to make it easier to get the tension you need. These are the best, and for some reason hard to get in the retail store and pharmacies in my area suddenly.  So glad AMAZON had them!
desc: Unique, Patented Floss Is Smooth, Strong And Shred Resistant Effectively Removes Tough Plaque Between Teeth Patented Tension Control Design

comments:
I got this at Costco for much cheaper. However, it stained my teeth brown as many people have complained about. Wish I had looked it up sooner. Going to return them to Costco now. Definitely would not recommend this mouth wash.

  Stained my teeth brown and black with consistent use (twice a day) over a few weeks. I take very good care of my teeth. I do not drink coffee. I do not drink tea. I do not smoke nor chew tobacco. But, after weeks of consistently using this mouthwash, my teeth started to stain brown near the gumline. Between my teeth, it started to stain a black color!! This appeared suddenly. I made an appointment with my oral hygienist and she was able to remove them. I do bit recommend buying this product

  I am definitely a convert to Crest Pro-Health mouthwash. It  does a fantastic job cleaning the teeth and keeping surface stains off. It can take a little getting used to at first as it is definitely a stronger mouthwash than the typical stuff out there, but it works extremely well. Highly recommended!

  After switching from Listerine (used more than 20 years) to this Crest Pro-Health mouthwash because I tried a sample free for review from Crest, I've found that my 2x daily oral care routine is fun and enjoyable!

  I received this product free through BzzAgent from Crest. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone, especially if your like me and don't like the burning sensation that you have when using other mouthwashes. I have been using it for well over a month now and can say I actually notice a change in the appearance in my teeth, they are brighter, no plaque buildup throughout the day and I have fresher breath. But I will say I was a little concerned reading the packing at first and noticed that it said that it could possible result in staining of your teeth which made me alarmed, but I have yet to see any staining of my teeth so I am very satisfied. 5/5.

  I should have done more research on this product.. The fine print says that it contains an ingredient that might stain teeth! I used this for about 3 days and noticed a brown stain in between my teeth.. Immediately stopped using it and slowly the stain started going away (after brushing intensely for a couple weeks). I did research and it says staining of teeth is a sign that the mouthwash is actually killing the bacteria.. So there are pros and cons to this mouthwash.

  I received a full size sample of this product as a BzzAgent. This mouthwash was a bit too strong for my liking, there's a bit of a burning sensitive when gargling. When I swish, it gets REALLY foamy so it's hard to keep all the bubbles contained! When I spit, it feels like a huge relief but I may also not be the best judge because even other OTCs like Listerine are too aggressive in my opinion. I might need to go back to the mouthwash I purchase from my dentist that doesn't contain any flavor or harsh chemicals.

  Literally the worst mouthwash I have ever used. Not only did it stain my teeth, it leaves this awful, weird taste in your mouth for a long time after you use it, and it made my teeth and gums extremely sensitive. I never complained about sensitivity in my mouth and had perfect dentist visits until I used this mouth wash. I threw it in the trash with half of the bottle left. Wish I could rate lower.
desc: Kills 99% of common germs that can cause plaque, gingivitis and bad breath Avoid the burn of alcohol 24-hour protection against plaque and gingivitis by using in your daily oral care routine Prevent and reduce gingivitis for healthy gums Keep teeth cleaner longer, versus brushing alone

comments: I purchased these on the special Friday sale where they were $7.99 for 3 cans. At the store where I normally shop here one can is almost $5 so this was a fantastic deal. I liked how they were lightly salted and not as salty as alot of nuts are.
I agree with the other review that they were mostly almonds. Id say 60% almonds, 30% cashews and 10% macadamias but they were still quite good.
We love almonds and cashews and I wanted some pecans for a recipe that called for them. I ordered these, in spite of the reviews, thinking I only needed a small amount...
But man were they right!! My husband and I ate 2 pecans each in a few handfuls of nuts each. Realizing they were so few and far between, I went ahead and started separating the rest...

I split the almonds and cashews up into snack bags for my husband's lunches and put the pecans into a single bag for my recipe. I took a photo for you to see, these were all the pecans (aside from the 4 pieces we'd eaten lol)...
I rated these 3 stars because they were delicious, although not exactly what we'd hoped for, in terms of ratios haha...
Hope this is helpful! Smile.
These are good nuts, very lightly salted, just the way we like them.
But, they are almost all almonds.
A little disappointed with that.  I was hoping they would be an equal mix of all the three variety of nuts.
Planters has this product labeled correctly, less than 50% peanuts.
Their are 49% peanuts, 49% almonds and 2% good nuts. :o(
They should have to list % of all nuts included and then forced to stand behind their claim.
Very poor product for the price you have to pay.
This review is for the Planters NUT*rition Heart Healthy Mix -

Usually these are priced the same as Planter's Deluxe Mix.  However, these contain a lot more peanuts, which are cheaper.  They contain peanuts, almonds, pistachios, pecans, walnuts and hazelnuts.  And I think that's the order of abundance as well.  Looking down into this fresh opened can here, I mainly see a lot of peanuts and almonds.  I don't find them particularly greasy or oily, but they certainly are not dry roasted.  The peanuts don't have skins.  They have 50mg of sodium, compared to 110 in most other Planter's mixes, and they have 600mg of Potasium, compared to the 500mg in the deluxe mix.

I was chagrined by the contents; way too salty, so that the nuts had little flavor left. Also, the peanuts were about 80%, and low grade examples at that. Not a gourmet item, might be all right for commercial use.

Well over half of the can is peanuts.  Not sure how heart healthy that is.  Almonds seem to be the second runner up and then the other nuts are thrown in here and there.  I think there was 5 pistachios in my entire can.  Don't waste your time... mix and match at the health food store or find a brand with no peanuts.

This is an incredibly deceitful marketing ploy to sell a lot of over priced peanuts.  As other reviewers state, this product is OVER 50% peanuts.  Although they are lightly salted, which is nice, you would be better off with a generic, low salt mixed nut product from your local store (for a fraction of the price).

comments: I have been using this product for about 2 weeks now and I can honestly say that I have been pleasantly surprised at the results.  Not only has my libido improved but is has cut down on my nightly visits to the bathroom which has also improved me quality of sleep.

I never had an issue with having to get up at night and go to the bathroom.  I hit 50 and BAM - up every night.  I have even had to watch the clock to make sure I do not drink anything after a certain time in order to sleep though the night.  It has only been 4 days and I can tell this prostate health stuff is really working.  Last 2 nights have been un-interuppted sleep.  Obviously I can not tell how healthy my prostate is from the outside but I have no doubt this supplement is working well.
I hate jumping into reviews that call for extremes. I am inclined to do so here because l had truly unexpected results in the best of ways.

After a yearly medical examination l was told l had an enlarged prostate. That explained the strained and numerous nightly trips to the lew. I followed my Doc's advice yet wanted to try this first. I was not impressed by the lable reading that l might have to wait a month to notice results. I even thought how convenient considering each bottle contains a thirty day supply (convenient for them that is).
After one week there was an incredible increase in flow with no strain nor pain at all.

I seriously tried to find other reasons for this unexpected improvement but there were none. This problem with nightly visits had gone on so long that l was getting used to it, maybe even thinking it was normal.

No doubt about it now, this skeptic has been convinced. This works beyond my expectations which were nill anyway. There are several other beneficial results here and other than a much greater overall feeling of wellness, well, only my wife would attest to that.

I'm glad l had not read the reviews prior to my purchase because negatives cast too much of a doubt and five stars too many expectations. Yes l was in doubt but l am very pleased. I might just be the exception, that is the one guy this formula works well on but, l doubt that. I wanted to share my experience to thank those for many other reviews on many things in Amazon that helped my shopping choices.
Hope this helped. You owe it to yourself to at least feel somewhat better and get out from under unnecessary pain.

This is the third prostate supplement that I have tried over the last 3 years and the product that has worked the best for me. I had a scare three years ago when my PSA levels rose and I had to undergo a prostate biopsy. Therefore. I take my prostate health seriously. With this product I have noticed a significant improvement in my ability to void with less urgency and hesitancy. I would definitely recommend trying this product for those having BPH symptoms.

I don't leave many reviews but was inclined to leave this one. I just received my shipment of this product (Prostrate Health by Advanta). I had tried another product called Prostanew of which I still had a few capsules and is also available on Amazon. I got it a few dollars cheaper somewhere else. The effectiveness of that product is generally good. Well it turns out the "proprietary formula" of both products are IDENTICAL, word for word down the mg of each ingredient. So the formula I guess is not so "proprietary". I expect this product to work the same and it is several dollars cheaper than the other (Prostanew). Ratings and Price on Amazon as follows: Prostrate Health 4.5 stars at $20 VS Prostanew 3.5 stars at $23. So go figure.
This definitely helps. Stream is stronger. Really noticed the difference when I didn't take it for a couple days then started again. I take it regularly now.

Been taking for a couple of weeks.  Easy to swallow. No aftertaste.  My libido seems to have perked up a couple of points but it could be mental.  I look at it like my other multi vitamins I take everyday.  Based on my research it has all of the prostate supplements I was looking for but since I can't see it - I can only assume it is working.

I reserve five stars for products that live up to their claims. Simply put, this product works! In my mid-forties I have been waking up religiously at around 4 AM to go to the rest room. This became my new norm so I didn't give it much thought. After a few years I began reading about prostate health (just out of curiosity) and learned how prostates grow in size over time causing symptoms such as regularly getting up from your sleep to urinate.

After about a week or two of using this product, I find myself still waking up at night. However, all I do is roll over to my other side and go right back to sleep. The few times that I feel a need to get up from bed to urinate, I blow it off and go to sleep.

In addition, something else has happened that I was not expecting. I am again, often waking up in the morning "aroused" (for lack of a more polite term). My lady even complained this past Saturday that it is too much (as in too often) in one day (but we made love again anyway).

Just so you know, I am not some paid hack trying to get people to buy a product. Feel free to browse my other reviews. I have no ties to any manufacturer. I am simply basing my rating on my personal experience. I have about a ten day supply remaining and will be reordering this product.

The combination of zinc, selenium, and a little copper due to the zinc, coupled with saw-palmetto is what made me try this product. Other products did not have all of these nutrients in one. In addition, the zinc here is Zinc Picolinate, which is a very good form of zinc versus Zinc Oxide. This product also has vitamin E and B6 but I get those from other sources so that did not factor into my purchase.
The manufacturer recommends three capsules per day. I alternate between two and three per day, always with a primary meal.

desc: Magnesium Malate is a highly bioavailable form of magnesium. It contains di-magnesium malate, which is magnesium bound to malic acid. Magnesium is one of the most critical minerals in the human body, and is involved in hundreds of enzyme reactions. Malic acid is a compound found naturally in apples and other fruits and vegetables and is included because of its role in the Krebs cycle, the energy-producing system in the body. Malic acid helps to make energy by playing a role in the complex process of deriving adenosine triphosphate (ATP; the energy currency that runs the body) from food. Serving Size: 2 Capsules. Servings Per Container: 120. Ingredients: Amount Per Serving: Magnesium (As Di-Magnesium Malate) 360 milligrams. Other Ingredients: Microcrystalline cellulose, vegetable stearate. Non-GMO.

I did the Designs for Health two-week cleanse before starting a diet for food allergies. I admit I was skeptical at first. Shakes aren't sustainable for me. I'm usually hungry right away. However, with the cleanse diet menu, and adding blueberries, strawberries or cherries to the shake mix, I found myself full and easily made it through meals with healthy snacks (like a handful of nuts) in between. The vanilla tastes great with fresh strawberries. I use unsweetened vanilla almond milk most times, but like it with coconut milk as well.

I also use the Designs for Health chocolate. The vanilla is more powdery - so it tends to "smoke" when I put the scoops in a blender. The chocolate is a heavier powder and doesn't "smoke." It's best to put in frozen fruits - like blueberries - then put the vanilla scoop in. That tends to keep it from doing this.

My family uses these shakes as an alternative to milk shakes. They are much lighter, but hit the sweet tooth just right. I sometimes use a shake for a light dinner - especially if it is extremely hot outside and I don't want to a full meal. I have lost weight while drinking these shakes HOWEVER I also extremely changed my diet. Results may or may not be the same for you. Also, I wasn't taking the shakes for weight loss. They were part of a plan to get my body healthy again. Weight loss was just a bonus.
As always, you should consult a doctor before you do a cleanse of any kind, or if you plan to use these as a meal alternative.

Dealing with food allergies, it is a virtual miracle to find a product like this that is soy, dairy, and gluten free, wonderfully low in sugars, and yet high in protein and very palatable.  I mix the powder with unsweetened almond milk for a shake for breakfast and it lasts me through the morning without any hunger pangs.  The vanilla flavor is sweet enough for my sweet tooth.  Kudos for doing all this with virtually no sugar.  I feel better since I've been having it for breakfast. Thanks, Amazon and your merchants for the GREAT price and Prime delivery!

It is still hard to eat vegan or vegetarian while having a steady supply of energy and a great attitude.  This powder supports both.  The flavor isn't great, but the results are.  Recommended.
Update:  My doctor found that this powder really spikes the measurement they use to monitor kidney function.  I am no longer allowed to use this product.  I am a male in my thirties.  My wife is still allowed to use it, as women respond differently to protein then men.  Just a heads up.  I still think it is a good product, but not for me.

I guess if you're used to a s***load of chocolate flavoring and sugar being pumped into your protein shake then this wouldn't live up to that, but this shake tastes exactly like what it is: a bunch of veggies and a hint of cocoa powder. I tried many different protein shakes before trying this one, but this has become my only choice now. The only down side is that it's a bit expensive, but nothing comes close to it in terms of how much healthy protein you get per dollar spent.

desc: Protein supplements come in many forms. Some are a better fit for us than others. Egg albumin and whey proteins have long been considered the best -- until now. The amino acid profiles of albumin and whey supply all the essential amino acids needed by human muscle, although not quite in the proper ratios to precisely match. They nevertheless are efficiently utilized by the human body to build muscle tissue and other structures. What isn't needed for tissue building is usually burned up for energy production. Indeed, about 55% of dietary protein is commonly converted to energy. That is actually a good thing because conversion of protein to energy happens at a gradual pace, resulting in sustained and steady blood sugar levels.

desc: For centuries, olive oil has been one of the mainstays of the Mediterranean diet. comments: Let me start by saying that I am not one to write product reviews on any health supplement product, as I don't usually notice a significant change in the way I feel. After taking Green Vibrance now for almost a week, I am too excited about the results not to write a review.

I had been feeling generally fatigued, run-down, achey joints, fluctuating hormone levels (47 yo female), foggy-headed, forgetful, depressed at times and packing on the pounds over the years. I was under the impression that I must be premenopausal with irregular hormone levels or something, how else could I explain the feeling of all my energy being leeched from my body for a few years now? I found it difficult to make it through an entire day of work every day.

I originally began taking GV about 6 months ago and remember that I had began to feel better. I would take it in the morning for a light breakfast. Everyone complains about the taste, well it is awful and tastes like hay or grass, however, when you see how good this stuff makes you feel, who cares?  I found that taking it in approx 6 oz of Minute Maid's Pomegranate Blueberry juice helps to disguise the flavor tremendously, so this is the only way I take it now.

For whatever reason, I quit taking GV after a couple weeks, as I think I was either in a rush or just plum forgot some mornings. Slowly the improved feeling of well-being and energy began to disappear. Well, when I opened my freezer last week and saw the canister sitting there, I thought that I might as well put it back to use. After taking it again for almost a week now, my energy is returning, my head is clearing up - I have improved focus and memory, decreased achey joints, and an overall markedly increased general sense of well-being. Why was I so foolish to have quit taking this stuff before?  I don't know, but one thing is for certain now, I will never be without it again!
Fantastic. Stopped my arthritis pains, hair thicker, feel better.

I figured this would be a great supplement to add to my stack of omega3's, multivitamin, BCAA's, glutamine, Creatine, whey isolate, casein, green tea extract, agmatine sulfate, beta alanine, cirtrulline Malate, and an organic whole foods diet.
Maybe I don't need any of these supplements. But I did gain 15 lbs of muscle in 3 months and my strength increased so much that my joints can't keep up. Now I gotta add Chondroitin.

comments: I was very excited when I discovered this product on Amazon.com. I had never heard of it before, but when I read about the details of the product, it sounded like a product that was especially geared for people that have skin like me. I have very sensitive skin, so I avoid using skin-care products that contain fragrance. This particular "Home Health" cream is very sensitive-skin-friendly! On the side of the label, it reads: "No Parabens, No Petroleum, No Artificial color, No Fragrance, No Animal Products, No Gluten." It is hard to find skin-care products that don't contain some of those aforementioned elements.

I have noticed a remarkable change in my facial skin since using this cream...My skin seems firmer and softer. The ingredients in this cream that help improve your skin's surface are the following: Hyaluronic Acid, Vitamins A, E, B & C, Green Tea Extract, and Grape Seed.
This product claims on the front label to be a Hyaluronic Acid cream. But read the list of ingredients. It contains Sodium Hyaluronate, not Hyaluronic Acid.
Sodium Hyaluronate is the salt of hyaluronic acid and works differently. But it is beneficial.

The topical application of skincare products containing sodium hyaluronate--the salt of hyaluronic acid,"should not be confused with [hyaluronic acid] in some topical cosmetic products... Rubbing such products on the skin will not stimulate collagen production."
What is Hyaluronic Acid?

HA is the naturally occurring and widespread component found within the extracellular matrix (ECM) within bodily tissues, especially those of the face. Originally extracted from rooster combs, it is now produced as a reactive byproduct of benign bacteria and is identical to the substance found within the skin. Its water-binding and water-attracting attributes fill up the spaces between the connective fibers collagen and elastin in the dermis. When injected into the face, HA functions to hydrate and separate the skin, holding onto water and supporting all that makes the face plump and voluptuous.
What is Sodium Hyaluronate?
Sodium hyaluronate has a smaller molecular size as HA (making it especially penetrative), and is able to hold more water than any other natural substance--up to 1,000 times its weight in water!

Thanks to these to attributes, when applied topically to the skin it can reach deep down into the dermis to combine with, maintain and attract water. It also promotes skin/blood microcirculation and nutrient absorption, and helps maintain normal metabolism.
Over all both are good. I think Hyaluronic Acid is best and am not please when a label leads people to believe that is what is in the product.

When I received this cream (12 days after ordering), the jar was not sealed and appeared to be either partially used or partially spilled. (The jar was approximately half full, and the threads of the jar and lid were coated with cream.) Finding this unsanitary and unacceptable, I followed Nutricity's return instructions. I paid the return shipping. Today I received this response from Nutricity: "We have received the order that was returned to our facility. I want you know that this specific product does not come with any safety seals.  This product was shipped out exactly as we received it.  As such, we have determined that this product was indeed unused at the time it was shipped out to you. Please know that we are unable to accept returns of personal care items, as stated in Nutricity's and Amazon's returns policies. As such, we will not be able to issue a refund for this order." I never tried the cream. This was a $20 loss. I will avoid Home Health products and Nutricity as a seller.

I have used many face creams and I like this one as it is nourishing the skin as it moisturizes it.  This is not one fourth ounce, it is a four ounce jar and I have used two of them and have ordered more.

Alright, having heard about the magic potion called Hyaluronic Acid, I wanted to try one and see what is it all about. I ordered it, got it on time and applied the cream for almost 1 week on my face, around my dark circles, on forehead etc. Bottomline, the dark circles start fading, the area starts getting moisturized and I can say within a week that it does have some effect. I will post an update in 5-8 weeks from now.

Downside is the smell..which is acidic. If you want to know how it smells like then it is the smell of a thinner reduced down by 10 notches. Better, try and buy Loreal Anti-Wrinkle Cream with Hyaluronic Acid and thats how it smells like. No big deal thought as the potion is effective.

Another downside is the packing. there is no seal on the packing and you cannot know how many hands have touched it before you. This cream is effective but the packing makes it very risky if you are hygiene sensitive individual. If the company does not changed its packing on this material, I would recommend buying this from someone else as the risks of infection are far higher than the ability of cream to moisturize the skin. I read here that one of the customers had even written to the company but they never responded.
I would rather pay 10 bucks extra rather than get a disease due to the cream being possibly touched by many hands.

Bottomline...cream is effective...does the work...packing is a no no..in some countries you may not be able to sell this off the shelf due to the lack of packing and safety standards applied towards packing. If the company is listening, they should immediately recall all the packs, puts seals on the packs and then reintroduce it.

comments: I use a Braun electric toothbrush and I really like this toothpaste. My teeth and mouth feel very similar to when I come back from the dentist and it feels that way all day long. It's kind of a little detail of life, having extra clean teeth but I like it.

As someone who suffers from periodontal disease, I am a little familiar with products designed to help cut plaque and reduced the incidence of gingivitis. My dentist has his list of preferred toothpastes, and I have tried a number of them. This is not on his list and I can see why.

The active ingredient is stannous fluoride. Many toothpastes have this as an active ingredient, so it comes up pretty standard there. In fact, the toothpaste I use regularly has both fluoride and an active antibacterial agent. Since gingivitis is caused by bacterial growth, what I use currently is more likely to be effective than this product.

It doesn't mention there is grit in the paste as a whitening agent. When I first started to brush for the first time I thought I had put the wrong material on my brush. It felt like there was sand in the toothpaste. The grit acts as a whitening agent, but if you ask any dentist, they will tell you to stay far away from it because it scours the enamel on the teeth. And, enamel is not replaceable....once it is gone it is gone for good.
The product has a strong mint taste that is not disagreeable.

If you plan to use this, take it to your dentist first and see what they think. If you like it and the dentist says its okay for you, then give it a try. Both my periodontist and my regular dentists said they wouldn't recommend it to anyone due to the grit.

I am definitely a convert to Crest Pro-Health toothpaste. It uses more fluoride than regular toothpaste and has a sort of grainy texture that does a fantastic job cleaning the teeth and keeping surface stains off. It can take a little getting used to at first as it is definitely a stronger toothpaste than the typical stuff out there, but it works extremely well. Highly recommended!

My dental hygienist suggested that I start using toothpaste to protect my sensitive, receding gums. She gave me a sample of Sensodyne and after trying it (three different times - denial), I decided that having sensitive gums is better than that gaggy, horrible "flavor" Sensodyne has (and leaves behind).
So, after getting scolded at my last teeth cleaning appointment, she, again, strongly suggested that I try the Crest Pro-Health version.

So, I did.  And I'm happy (and relieved) to report that this is a great toothpaste and it tastes MUCH better than Sensodyne with no gagging involved. My gums have definitely improved and the sensitivity to hot and cold has become less so. Hooray for that!
I'm glad I'm being proactive with my dental care and Crest Pro-Health Clinical Gum Protection Toothpaste has sure made it easier to do so.
If you're older and you want to save your gums, one brushing at a time, this is the product for you.

My periodontist was a nice guy and all but I never liked it when he said we would be together forever.  I'm willing to make that kind of commitment to children and dogs but not a periodontist.  After listening to that four times every year, I went looking for my own solutions.
I was able to turn around a periodontal problem with two things: the Crest Pro-Health toothpaste series and my perfect special
.  Sadly my favorite Crest pro health morning and night toothpastes have not been readily available in my area so I've been experimenting.
The invigorating mint has a good flavor to it.  I've put it in the morning slot.

I bought this product from my grocery store, but I do review on amazon often. This toothpaste seemed wonderful at first. It was really minty and tasted good. I had to brush my teeth again with a discount toothpaste my parents got. And then eat carrots for another twenty minutes because I couldn't stand without something moving in myiuth because the goo would come back. Never buying again, I'd rather go without brushing than go through that ordeal again. Nasty.

This toothpast is my favorite one so far. It is great at reducing tooth sensitivity, it has a very handy snap on and off cap. It also seems to whiten well, and makes my teeth feel clean, but not a strong peppermint that can sometimes feel too strong. This toothpaste has a mild mint taste. Since using it, eating ice cream no longer hurts my teeth. If you have sensitive teeth, get this stuff, you will love it. Even if you don't have sensitivity, you will still like it because it is a great all around toothpaste.

  May be better if they add a few mg of black pepper, but still OK... Curcumin(one of components in turmeric), milk thistle silymarin. These two components are actually ingredients for Protandim which mainly aims for Nrf2 pathway activation although their significance on human body is still unknown. Indeed, both of above components are mTOR inhibitors. (mTOR is the protein in human, which regulate cellular growth, cellular signalling, and many things). And, mTOR is activated, for example, when leucine (dietary protein that you can find in animal, soybeans and dairy products etc..,) is in excess state. (There are some other proteins that do this job, but typically leucine is strong activator of mTOR). In some senses, people activate mTOR for some purposes(such as muscle synthesis and growth, which I don't agree that much). On the other side, inhibition of mTOR may be associated with cancer inhibition, cellular signalling, or enhanced hormetic responses.. etc... So, activation/ inhibition of mTOR is different in context. Though, if some person is doing calorie restriction or intermittent fasting, it may be OK to try this product when you are in non-fasted state for inhibiting them.
Note: Inhibition and activation of mTOR with supplement form is still unclear of their significance, so above review is mainly based on vitro studies.

Designs For Health - Magnesium Glycinate Chelate is the best Magnesium on the market.  I've tried dozens of "formulas" and brands, which were all a waste of money.   I've used several types of magnesium supplements as part of a migraine-prevention regimen. I started out using magnesium oxide (the kind you'll find in supermarkets under brands like Nature Made), but saw zero effect. I then switched to a magnesium citrate formula sold by GNC, but those led to immediate gastrointestinal side effects which never went away during the couple of months I took them.
Enter magnesium glycinate and this formula from Designs for Health. The benefit of magnesium glycinate is that it is very well-absorbed by the body, which means that it isn't simply passing through your system and causing all the intestinal adventures that you get from other forms. As a result, I don't have to take doses as high as I used to take; one of these 150 mg capsules daily is enough for me. I have noticed a reduction in headaches -- a welcome surprise, given the unusual hot-to-cold weather patterns we experience here in the South each spring. I feel more relaxed, and my sleep is improving as well.
