comments: First, I'll try to limit the hyperbole here.  I like this stuff a lot, enough said.  Read on for why.

I'm not a supplement-type.  I go to the gym and, as much as I still don't like the taste of it -- I eat my broccoli.  I've always believed that exercise and a good diet were all that I needed.  I decided to give this stuff a try for 3 main reasons:

1)  The other positive reviews.  Amazon customers have rarely let me down -- from my rice cooker, to my books, to this stuff -- I've come to trust what people write on here as long as it doesn't sound like an obvious shill.

2)  Over the last couple of years I've stumbled on study after study saying how important D3 is for health, and what a large percentage of the population is D3 deficient.  I'm a pasty ginger, and I avoid the sun.  I figured, why not give it a try.

3)  It's not fish oil.  Need I say more?  Several years back I tried cod liver oil capsules that gave me the most rotten-fishy burps one can imagine.  I'll never forget that day at work -- I had to run out of a meeting because of it.  This stuff tastes like a drop of olive oil, and nothing else.  I can put it on anything.

The results?  Hard to quantify without a blood test, but suffice to say I feel 20 years younger and have noticably more energy, everyday, and especially at the gym.  I've recommended this supplement to everyone in my family and I'm recommending it to you.

I've been taking the Vitamin D3 drops since January this year.  I live in a very northern climate so don't get much if any sunshine during the winter months.  No bad taste with the product, just tastes like olive oil.  I put 1-2 drops on my tongue every morning.

I've had asthma for years and used an Albuteral inhaler as needed.  Depending on the season, I usually used it 1 time daily and once in a while more than that.  I always refused to inhale anything with steroids, my doctor was not always happy about this, but I know what steroids do to the body.  Over the past few years I've tried many different herbs, supplements, anything to try to help my lungs and get rid of asthma.  Nothing really worked.  About three weeks ago, I noticed that my lung function was greatly improved.  I haven't used my inhaler for 3 weeks, this has not happened in at least 12 years.  I've exercised and haven't had any wheezing or asthma symptoms (I used to ALWAYS carry my inhaler when I exercised and usaully had to use it).  It's amazing!  The only thing that I've changed in my supplements is taking the Vitamin D3 drops.  They work and I'm thinking the Asthma was related to a Vitamin D deficiency in my body!

I got this liquid vitamin D for my mother who suffers from Alzheimer's type dementia after she tested very low (14) for vitamin D. After giving this to her with her other meds mixed into apple sauce along with some good old fashion sunshine she tested three months later at (58), the nurse calling her little Miss Sunshine. Using this also improved her mood noticeably.

2,000 IUs in one drop make's it SOOO much easier to administer than 100 IUs per drop.  The Dropper is not the best - if it is full of liquid it tends to just drop out of the dropper without having squeezed the bulb.  Now I make sure that there is next to nothing in the dropper before I take it out of the bottle.
I'll definitely purchase this again.

desc:
Vitamin D is essential for the functioning of many important systems in the body, and recent research has suggested that we may need much more vitamin D than previously thought for optimum immune function and long-term health.

Adequate vitamin D levels may reduce the risk of many chronic diseases in the long term, including:

Autoimmune Disorders1
Diabetes4
Cancer2,3,4
Osteoporosis4
Rheumathoid Arthritis4
High Blood Pressure4

Vitamin D360 is pure and potent Vitamin D3 supplement in an olive oil base, providing 2000 IU of cholecalciferol per drop. Most people do not get sufficient vitamin D3 in their diet, and the synthetic vitamin D2 that is added to dairy products is an inferior form of this vital nutrient, and is added in too small of an amount. Vitamin D3 occurs naturally in fatty fish, cod liver oil, egg yolks, and beef liver. Vitamin D360 contains only cholecalciferol derived from cholesterol in sheep's wool, making it suitable for vegetarians.

Some factors that contribute to vitamin D deficiency include:

Spending most of the day indoors
Using sunscreen
Wintertime & less sunny climates
Darker skin tone (melanin blocks UVB rays, which produce vitamin D in the skin)

Vitamin D deficiency symptoms vary depending on the individual, so consulting with a physician and testing vitamin D levels, as supplementing with too much vitamin D can cause elevated blood calcium levels which can have serious health effects. Measuring 25 hydroxy vitamin D levels is the preferred test for determining vitamin D deficiency; if the level is less than 80, taking a vitamin D3 supplement may be one of the most valuable steps you could take for long-term health.

The liquid format of Vitamin D360 makes it simple to tailor the dose to fit your specific needs, and is easier to take than capsules, especially for small children. Vitamin D360 is free from fillers, flow agents, preservatives, or flavors. It contains no wheat, gluten, dairy, corn, soy, fish, shellfish, or nuts.

comments: Like many, I became interested in chia seeds after reading ""Born to Run" and started to use chia seeds on a daily basis (usually mixed in with my morning smoothie).  I have purchased chia seeds from different producers in order to find the best product and have found that HW's chia seeds are the best around.  The chia seeds are of high quality (no imperfections like dirt or other products mixed in with the seeds), the packaging is great (great design/logo and, more importantly, is durable and sturdy unlike some of the other seeds that I have received in ziplock bags) and the company has a very informative website that has great recipes and information about the product.  I also purchased the HW chia bars at the same time (separate review) and thought they were excellent.  I have been an Amazon customer for many years and have never reviewed a product but felt compelled to do so when I read an earlier review which accused the company of placing positive reviews.  I thought it was an unfair (borderline slanderous) accusation to make and makes me doubt the credibility and question the intentions of the author as it doesn't appear that she bought the product (doesn't appear to be an Amazon Verified Purchase) or even mention the product in her "review".  She is either a conspiracy theorist or has an ulterior motive, either way I thought her review was pretty "lame" (quoting her review).  Bottom line is that HW has a great product and I am another satisfied customer (check out some of the user reviews on the HW website).  I am happy to be contacted if anybody has any questions about my review or the product as I think that the benefits of chia seeds are real and HW has the best product on the market.

I'm kinda new to running and working out. (A couple months in)  I'm 26 and I have been a 1/2 pack a day smoker for 12 years. I was never very athletic. I am usually kind of dragging and drained after a workout. I don't like the idea of sports drinks and supplements that are heavily processed with nasty chemicals and preservatives.

So I got the chia seeds because I thought they would have many of the things my muscles need to repair themselves after a workout. ( I also eat greek yogurt post-workout which has 46% DV of protein in a cup)

I ordered the chia stuff and had been putting it in oatmeal, homemade bread and stuff. The smell and flavor of the seeds is actually pretty good. Although the oatmeal/chia combo is tastey and does give me some energy in the mornings, NOTHING compares to the effects of drinking chia gel!
I had the chia seeds for 4 days and hadn't yet tried the gel mixture. Today I had a really hard run and workout. I was VERY tired and just straight-up drained. So I decided to try the ChiaGel...

The energy replenishment was INSANE!! In 20m I was completely restored and full of energy. I still had the 'after workout buzz' but my energy level was higher than even before I started my workout. I feel like I could go straight back to the gym for more... but I won't. lol

When I made my Chia Gel, I followed some advice from a video on a popular video-sharing website I'll call 'Us-Tube' (don't know if I'm allowed to put the actual name here)  I suggest you all try it just like this because the seeds visibly react to the water and then to the citrus acid. WOW the effects this drink has are good!
1/2 Tbs Chia
6oz water
Stir constantly 5 min
add lemon juice
add agave nectar (or sugar, or honey)
DRINK
The Gel has a very good flavor, although the seedy mixture takes some getting used to. But after seeing how powerful this is, I wouldn't care if it tasted like wolfcrap!

I am a first-time reviewer, but I had to share this Chia success story: I trained with the Chia seeds for the approx. 4 weeks preceding the Oak Brook Half Marathon on Labor Day, Sep 5. Prior to training runs, I would soak 2 tablespoons of Chia seeds in water for 30 minutes, then squeeze juice from a fresh lime or orange into the mixture for taste. The night before my race, I mixed 2 tablespoons of Chia seeds in water, then put the mixture in the refigerator overnight, and drank the cold mixture (along with fresh juice squeezed from a raw orange) 60 minutes prior to race time the next morning. I've run this race twice before: the course has a punishing series of up-and-down hills at miles 7 and 8 that in the past have left my legs and energy levels shot. For two years in a row, my splits for miles 9-13 were approx. 30-45 seconds slower per mile than my pace in the opening 6 miles. But this year, with the amazing energy, nutrients and hydration provided by my pre-race Chia drink, I was able to maintain the same overall pace after the hills at 7 & 8 - in fact, my split for mile 13 (7:25) was just two seconds slower than my split for mile 1 (7:23), something I have never accomplished in any race. I finished the race in 1:37:26, 14th out of 96 in my age division, 108 out of 1166 overall, the second-fastest half marathon time I've ever run, and a whopping 5:30 faster than the same race in 2010. Thanks Health Warrior!

Chia is by far the best super food on the market!  This "Running Food" has improved my strength and endurance more than any other supplement I tried in my 23 year training career.  The fiber it provides has really helped me curb my appetite which has gotten me into the best shape of my life!  The high dose of antioxidants (more than a serving of blueberries) provides the cancer fighting nutrition that is essential for a long healthy life.  Most importantly Health Warrior sells the highest quality Chia seed on the market....ORGANIC, NO TILLAGE FARMING, HARVESTED AT PEAK TIME AND FULLY TRACEABLE.  I received my order super fast.  Great product, great dealer.  Thanks Health Warrior!

comments: Sure there are only a total of 3 buttons and it seems fairly easy to navigate without reading the directions but I am here to tell you to not be a knucklehead and actually read the directions prior to use! You have to hit buttons in a certain sequential order for it to give you a proper reading. I tried to be "that guy" and just wing it lol. I could have saved myself time and frustration by just reading the simple directions. These directions also tell you where exactly to place the tape measure in order to get an exact reading for that particular body part. Moving a half an inch higher or lower than the designated spot can give you an inaccurate reading. Awesome product!!

I've had a lifestyle change and have been working out daily for the last few months and have lost quite a bit of weight.  I've wound up picking up a habit of monitoring my weight, activity levels, calorie intake, etc.  It is cathartic as much as it is motivating: the ability to directly quantify actions and their results.  Being able to monitor my body's progress, in terms of measurements, is a good thing, and I wish I had picked up one of these sooner.

This tape measure is exceedingly easy to use, but make sure you calibrate it first.  (With the measure fully retracted, press the power and select button at same time).  The last measurement memory is helpful, but since it only stores the last single measurement, I still think logging them in a workbook or spreadsheet is best.

Even if you aren't someone with a big fitness goal, this gadget has great utility if you do a lot of clothes shopping online.  Ever since I got a Prime subscription years ago, most of my clothes shopping has shifted to online purchases.  When it comes to clothes, each manufacturer has different sizing charts for what they consider small, medium, large, etc.  I never really knew my measurements; because returns are free here, I just ordered until I found something that fit.  It kind of wasted a lot of time and negated the benefits of free two day shipping.

A lot of clothing listings on Amazon don't have specific sizing charts available, but you can find exact sizing charts on most clothing manufacturer's websites.  Reference the manufacturer's sizing, buy inexpensively on Amazon (or wherever), and worry less about having to return and reorder.  The saved time will pay for this gadget many times over.  Very happy with my purchase.

Overall, this product is pretty good. However, it can be a bit hard to get consistent measurements. I usually take at least 2 measurements of the same body part and then average them. They can be up to an inch and a half off from one another. But this might just be my fault and not the product's.

The product is a bit wide, so it might be wider than some of your body parts (it's wider than my wrists and forearms for example (I am a 5'6" girl)). Therefore, there will be a noticeable gap between your body and the tape (near the unit). So you know the measurement isn't correct.
I also wish the product would have included some tips for measuring yourself, such as how tight the tape should be, in what position you should measure each body part, etc.

Also, be careful not to connect the tape the wrong way. The picture doesn't really show this, but the tape is permanently connected to one end of the unit (where the tape comes out) and the other end of the tape can be connected or disconnected from the unit as needed. If you accidentally rotate the tape, you might connect it to the unit backwards. It can be a pain to get it disconnected again if you do this, so watch out.

As an FYI, these are the body parts the product measures. It will record your last measurement for each part for you. But you can choose to just ignore the body part it says and measure whatever you want:
* Neck
* Shoulders
* Chest
* Bicept (1 side only)
* Waist
* Hips
* Thigh (1 side only)
* Calf (1 side only)

I liked the idea of  a digital readout becasue of the chance of mis-reading a conventional tape measure.  I found this product to be very accurate and very useful for tracking changes in your body.  Highly recomended

I like accuracy when it comes to my measurements as I work on my fitness. I use tape measures but they tend to get out of shape and become inaccurate. Plus, you can't determine your exact measurement. So, that's why I bought this. I had a bit of trouble understanding how it worked at first and customer service was totally no help.

So, I read the instructions several times clear through and worked with the unit. I like the way it easily goes from cm to inches. The readings are accurate. Here why: When you take a measurement, the tape will stop and not let your skin go in like a measuring tape will do. Of course, you must measure in the same place each time you do a measurement or it will be inaccurate. That's not always easy to do. I often take two or three readings and accept the largest one (as much as I hate to.) At least I know that's the right one.
I do wonder how long the tape itself will last. Only time will tell. But of all the measuring devices I have used, I like this one the best and highly recommend it.

UPDATE: I've had two of these because this one broke. Actually, the tape end tore off, causing the entire tape to retract, making it useless. I bought another one and within two years it did the same thing. Now, two years is a reasonably long run I guess. But I want something that measures and that I use only weekly to last longer. So, I'm going back to my MyoTape. I also question the accuracy of this product. It some cases it runs about the same as a regular tape. But, in other cases, not so much. My waist, measured at the same place, was often up to an inch smaller with this unit and while flattering, I'm not convinced it's accurate.
-- Susanna K. Hutcheson

comments: These bars have an attractive appearance, not unlike an oatmeal cookie with a drizzle of glaze. The texture is a bit sticky, somewhat chewy with little crunch. Flavor wise, the cinnamon predominates. I like cinnamon and this was a little harsh. The raisins were moist. It was rather enjoyable when taken with a full cup of coffee. They contain 7 grams of fiber including psyllium so it is imperative to drink with eight ounces of fluids. Each bar has 150 calories, 2.5 grams of fat, and a whopping 30 grams of carbs. They are individually wrapped making them easy to transport. However they do tend to have a laxative effect so I would think twice about taking them on the road. They are adequate for a light breakfast for an inactive person  and an easy way to boost fiber intake. They do contain soy, wheat and milk and are made in a factory that also processes tree nuts, seeds, milk and soy. The expiration date on my box, which I purchased on sale at CVS, was June 2015. These weren't bad although I could taste the cinnamon hours later. I thought the carb count was high for such a small bar. They do not hold you for long. While  fairly tasty I doubt I will buy them again.
The taste is OK,  easier to eat than the wafers and you can eat them on the go. Biggest negative is the Price.  Cost almost $2.00 a bar.
From their site:

Ingredients: Rolled oats, corn syrup, crisp rice (rice flour, malt extract, salt), raisins, invert sugar, granola (rolled oats, sugar, canola oil, honey, molasses), corn syrup solids, psyllium husk, raisin paste, glycerin, white compound coating (sugar, palm kernel oil, corn syrup solids, whey protein isolate, titanium dioxide, soy lecithin, salt, natural and artificial flavors), sunflower oil, natural flavors, gum acacia, soy lecithin, salt, tocopherols.
---3x corn syrup listed, 2x sugar listed, 2x salt listed, molasses and of course "white compound coating".

---"Titanium Dioxide Classified as Possibly Carcinogenic to Humans"  Titanium dioxide has recently been classified by the International Agency for Research on Cancer (IARC) as an IARC Group 2B carcinogen ''possibly carcinogen to humans''. Titanium dioxide accounts for 70% of the total production volume of pigments worldwide. It is widely used to provide whiteness and opacity to products such as paints, plastics, papers, inks, foods, and toothpastes. It is also used in cosmetic and skin care products, and it is present in almost every sunblock, where it helps protect the skin from ultraviolet light.
Check it out online.
I really like these bars, low calorie, filling and taste good.  BUT DON'T BUY ON AMAZON, YOU CAN GET THEM AT TARGET ON SALE FOR $5.99 (regular price $7.49)
Ewe!
Cinnamon Oatmeal Raisin is one of my favorite flavors in nutrition/granola bars.
But these are the first ones I dislike so much! First off, they are ridiculously overpriced. I caved in to try it when it was on sale at CVS along with a $2 off coupon in the Sunday coupons.
I love South Beach Cinnamon Raisin bars (which I get auto shipments from Amazon). These are delicious and light.
And one of my favorite LUNA bar flavors is their Iced Oatmeal Raisin which is actually similar to the South Beach bars.

But this Meta Health Fiber Bar just tastes gross. The texture is literally like wet /moist rice krispies that are going stale. Squishy, no crunch or crisp parts at all, so soggy, not even very chewy. I tried another one today hoping that second opinion was important. Gross! What a waste of money. If interested in the health bars and like the flavor, try the ones above that I recommend.
[I'd also jump to give them to a friend or acquaintance looking for fiber and nutrients in here, but don't wait to torture them.]

I first saw these individually wrapped and being sold in the pharmacy section of a store. I was shopping while hungry and decided to buy a few. I've tried other brands of "health" bars before and never liked the other options. These were not too dry and actually have a good flavor. I know taste is subjective so they are not for everyone. I started eating these instead of sugary desserts. I can eat them as snacks when I'm not hungry enough for a full meal. They haven't given me any digestive problems and they aren't difficult for me to swallow.

One time I accidentally left one in my pocket and it was almost as if it melted, but it was nice and gooey (so if you don't like gooey stuff, don't leave it in your pocket or in someplace too warm). I happen to be fine with gooey food.
I didn't like the lemon cranberry version of these bars, but I love the cinnamon oatmeal raisin.

I can't really speak to the health benefits or lack thereof because I don't really care enough about counting calories, carbs, sugars, etc. I'm more concerned with whether or not it tastes good and whether or not it makes me sick. I have a sensitive stomach and some food allergies and these don't seem to cause any problems for me.

Pros: good flavor, staves off hunger when I drink water while eating them so I don't eat too many of them (because I could probably down a whole box one sitting if they didn't make me feel full/satiated), moist enough to eat / swallow even without a beverage (but its better with a beverage).
Cons: gets gooey and falls apart when it gets too warm (which some people may like, but others may not)
I would recommend this product.

comments:
I've read a lot about L-Methylfolate and wanted to try it. It's considered a medical food and works differently than antidepressants. The brain uses L-Methylfolate to make more of the neurotransmitters that affect mood. A majority of people with depression have a genetic mistake, called the MTHFR polymorphism. It is an enzyme defect that compromises the body's ability to break down folate (from the diet or from synthetic folic acid found in vitamin supplements) into the L-methylfolate the brain needs to make neurotransmitters.
I like the fact that this product doesn't have any magnesium stearate, an additive found in many supplements and may be harmful therefore a cause for concern. Each capsule is 1000mcg. of Folate as Metafolin, a registered trademark of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt,Germany. L-methylfolate as Metafolin requires no conversion by the body and is superior to folic acid. While shopping around I found this product and bought some because I was impressed with the ingredients, dosage and good price.

  I have low thyroid and this really has helped me to have more energy throughout the day...plus keeps in a good mood! I will definitely be buying more!!

  My son is on the ASD spectrum and has the MTHFR mutation.  Both my husband and I have the mutation as well.  After a few days of taking this, I literally feel way different.  I have a greater sense of well being, more energy, and just feel better.  I've felt like I've had no energy for years now with no explanation and now I know why.  It is a must have for anyone with the MTHFR mutation.

  Good product at one of the higher dosages I could find otc, which is useful when you're trying this to replace the 15 mg Deplin you've been requested to take by your physician.

  My son has trouble breaking down folate (MTHFR gene mutation) and this product provides a form of folate which is more easily processed (or, more accurately, is preprocessed for you). I think it is helping him. I also like that there aren't a lot of "extra" ingredients added to the formula (my son is very sensitive to most chemicals, etc.). So, if you need to add some folate to your system/diet, I would recommend this product.

  Though it's still early in the game to evaluate fully, i feel like this brand works very well. I do have the genetic mutation and resulting problems. The work of Dr. Ben Lynch has helped me tremendously to figure out why i can never seem to detox no matter what i try. I'm now more hopeful than i've ever been since he is instrumental in the making of this formula.

  I had been taking prescription strength l-methylfolate, brand name Deplin, which is not covered by insurance & is expensive. I decided to try this, which I assumed is basically the same thing, just less milligrams. So to equal the Deplin I was taking (15mg.) I had to take 15 pills a day. I did not get the same energizing, clear-thinking effect as I do with Deplin, so I went back to my prescription.

  I love the high quality of the Seeking Health products. I take this because of my MTHFR mutation and this product makes all the difference in the world. My only complaint about this specific product is that it is 1000 mcg. It's a nice low dose to start off at because you should start slow, but once you start getting up to high doses, it's not very economical.

I have found that probiotic quality must be high if you truly want them to work well to control your symptoms. Private Label Nutrceuticals makes a high quality product that doesn't disappoint. It has 15 billion CFUs, but I saw as much improvement with many gut-related symptoms with this as I have with other probiotics that ranged anywhere from 20 billion CFUs to 120 billion CFUs. This is made in the USA.  The suggested dose is 1-2 per day, so the bottle of 60 would last 30 days if you take 2 per day.
Nothing in this review is intended as medical advice.

#8,070 in Health & Personal Care (
)
desc: Joint Vibrance provides cartilage-building cells called chondrocytes with the proper nutrients necessary for construction of new cartilage and synthesis of hyaluronic acid. It is the most comprehensive formula to nutritionally support healthy joint function. The entire formula is truly remarkable, and provides sound nutritional support for joint health. Before we are born, chondrocytes work rapidly to build protection into our developing skeletons. Then we are born, grow, and age. The older we become, the slower chondrocytes work. As chondrocyte activity flags over time, they eventually fail to adequately compensate for the daily wear and tear placed on joints by an active lifestyle. As a result, nearly everyone has some degree of cartilage breakdown by the age of 32 to 35. For centuries it was thought that the gradual deterioration made joint pain and loss of mobility an inevitable fact of aging. Today?s science has shown us that the function of cartilage-building cells (chondrocytes) can be sustained as long as their nutritional requirements are met. Cartilage can indeed be brought back to greater levels of health, strengthened and thickened if proper nutrients are supplied. There is one controlling principle in the effort to rebuild cartilage: There must be some cartilage with viable chondrocytes in the joint in order for repair to proceed. If prior joint surgeries have removed all cartilage, or if all cartilage in the joint has been worn completely away, then there would be no chondrocytes on site that could initiate the reconstruction process. But most damaged joints do retain a good measure of cartilage. They can benefit from Joint Vibrance.

comments:
For almost 10 years I have used the Oral-B Crossaction Toothbrushes with medium bristles and full heads.  I have always loved these brushes because the bristles are so stiff.  They remain in almost new condition for a couple of months.  They do a wonderful job cleaning and brushing is a pleasure instead of a chore.  (I have tooth sensitivity and I love the stiff bristles--soft bristles bother my teeth.)  Today I accidentally picked up the Crossaction Pro-Health and I was certainly disappointed.  I noticed the last set of bristles was green instead of white and the head size said large instead of full, but I thought Oral-B had just done a product makeover.  To my disappointment, the Crossaction Pro-Health cannot compare to the original Crossaction.  I just bought the Pro-Health today and the bristles are softer than those of my 3 month old used original Crossaction brush.  If Pro-Health was in big letters and they didn't look so similar I wouldn't complain, but the toothbrushes look exactly alike and Pro-Health is *tiny* on the packaging, so small that I didn't even notice it until I got the packaging out of the trash to include the UPC in my letter to Oral-B regarding the suspected makeover.  And that is how long it took me to realize that Oral-B hadn't done a makeover, I just bought the wrong brush.  Ugh...  Do yourself a big favor and buy the Oral-B Crossaction Toothbrush instead of the Oral-B Crossaction Pro-Health Toothbrush.  Happy brushing Amazonians. :)
UPDATE:  The Pro-Health version has replaced the original version and you can't get the original.  :'(

  i have been buying these toothbrushes for years and years.  Love the rubber edges and sculpted bristles.  They were just right for a long time.  However, in the last year of buying, them, at first I thought I got a defective batch and kept buying them.  The rubber tines along the edge shear off constantly and you find rubber plugs in your mouth when you are brushing and spit.  I don't like spitting out toothbrush parts every time I brush my teeth.  All the rubber tunes break off one by one and the rubber grip coating on the toothbrush end, peels off too.  I'm tired of this newly cheapened quality, choking hazard toothbrush.  My teeth haven't changed any (ie, I'm not brushing braces or anything), so I don't know if they changed their manufacturing formulas but these don't work anymore.

  Love these. They work nearly as well as my Sonicare and cost a lot less than new heads.
The price here is way out of line. They are available for $6.00 for the pair at the local discount monster store I almost never go to because of the super long lines and unsavory characters.
My wife loves these as well. When we broke open the pack and both used at the same time we were actually a little shocked at how well they worked and how it felt when using. It actually feels in your hand like you're doing something. I think that's the cross bristles, at angle to each other.
They wear out a little faster than other brushes but for $3.00 each who cares? I plan to stock up on these and replace as soon as they look worn.

comments:
After suffering from bloating and gas in the evenings, I decided to give this a try. I was tired of feeling sickly, and miserable every night. I started taking it with my evening meal. This product has worked wonders for me! It took about 2-3 weeks before I noticed a difference, but I no longer feel bloated or gassy in the evenings, and have even been able to indulge in beans on occasion, without the awful side effects I once had. I should mention that I also take medication for an under active thyroid, am female, age 46. I noticed no side affects whatsoever. I have been taking it for about a month and a half now, am thrilled with the results, and will continue buying this product.
Also, I noticed on this site it says for adults to take two capsules twice a day with meals, but on the actual bottle it says take one capsule daily with a meal, which is what I do.

  I normally don't write reviews but I just had to tell others what a life-changing pill this has been for me. I have suffered for years with severe constipation and bloating.  Recently I underwent a Sitz Marker study which showed I had "Severe Colonic Inertia".  Basically my colon doesn't move.  I was going weeks without "going" and after that it was still with major intervention.  I also had a colonoscopy after Sitz Marker and it confirmed the inertia. The dr said to try the Linzess again (which didn't help in the first place).  And if it didn't help, to see a surgeon about having my colon removed.  No way did I want to have surgery, but I thought I had exhausted all other options.  I have tried nearly everything I could think of and then some. I still always felt that finding the right probiotic just had to be the key to helping to some degree, but I didn't have any idea which one that would be.  So I did some more research.  I'm really not sure where I came across my info after googling "Best Probiotics for Constipation", but it lead me to this product. So, after reading the great reviews, I bought it with not much hope but felt I had nothing to lose.  I read it could take up to three weeks to start seeing results so I settled it. Well, to my delight, I began to see results in just a few days!  I began having small, soft BMs on my own!! This is MAJOR, people.  I can't even remember when I last went without an act of Congress.  As the week+ has gone by, it has gotten better. More formed and larger.  I will say that I also occasionally take Body Gold Colon Clenz with it, but not always.  And it is miraculous!  I hope I'm not jinxing myself by bragging so soon. But I just had to tell others that may be dealing with what I've dealt with to TRY THIS!!!  I hope it can provide the same results for you. Thank you, Philips, for making this awesome product!!

comments: What happens with me and my adrenal fatigue is, after a week or so of not taking an adrenal support supplement, I feel spacey, fatigued all the time like jet-lag, and have trouble sleeping.  I used to take Vital Nutrients adrenal support and I guess its my system, but I would always feel sleepy when I took it, and if I took too much I would feel sleepier, and it made my stomach upset.  So, when I ran out of it, I decided to try this Gaia Herbs brand because of the price, and the quality is great!  I love organic products when I can afford them.  I only take this when I feel a lag in energy, and my lack of energy is decreasing since I began taking this product.

Also, although it recommends 2 a day (twice), I don't take two, usually just one, and only once a day. Then if I still feel tired I take another. On very stressful days, I take two at a time. I have GAD and this product helps me handle stress and feel relaxed when otherwise my anxiety would drain my adrenal glands to the point of dysfunction.  I highly recommend this product to relieve your stress and fatigue.  I only drink coffee in the morning, and I never recommend caffeine in the evenings, but that is one thing that many people do which drains their adrenals.  Just a little FYI - try this instead!!
I'm not sure if its affecting my weight but I have lost weight since I started taking it... Which I'm happy about.  Heh.

I know this works well (for me) because I took one in the a.m. and one in the p.m. until one full bottle was gone. I am also taking a few other vitamins, supplements and amino acids (L-Tryptophan in particular is excellent) so when I finished the bottle of Adrenal Health I thought I'd wait and see how I felt or even if it made a difference.... I have a noticed a definite "drag" in my mood and physical energy since I ran out of this a week ago. I was really puzzled because I have not changed my nutrition at all (no processed foods, no sugar) and then I saw the empty bottle and remembered my little experiment! Of course. So, now I am back to order another bottle. The good thing about things like this product and L-Tryp, etc., is that once your body has built it's reserves back up then you can stop taking them, unlike Prozac or other artificial meds that just trick your body into thinking you have something you don't, there-by bankrupting your system even further than when you started taking the meds... hence increased doses and side effects. I am living proof that you can get off of anti-depressants & SSRI uptake inhibitors, etc., for good. Read The Mood Cure by Dr. Julia Ross, here at Amazon. It will change your life for the better. It did mine. Good luck.

comments:
I could not recommend this product more highly. I have a 12 year old german shepherd who suffers with arthritis. Our vet had prescribed Meloxicam, an NSAID. However, that category of drugs carries significant risks (ulcer formation as well as kidney or liver damage or failure). In my companion's case, it caused an ulcer even though I gave him Pepcid before each dose of Meloxicam.
A store owner recommended this product, and within less than one week, there was so much improvement I was able to completely discontinue the NSAID, and my dog is now even better than he was when he was on the NSAID medication.
Please note though that this is not the best concentration for large breed dogs. I learned that Liquid Health's 'L-5000' is designed for large dogs and is more highly concentrated. It too, is extremely effective.
I strongly urge the use of this supplement before resorting to medications that can cause serious to fatal internal damage.
My dog also finds it palatable, and I have not had any trouble feeding it to him, I just mix it in with his kibbles twice daily.

  I have purchased this for approximately the past year and it has truly helped out 19 year old Maltese!  I was to the point a year ago having to give him Metacam (Pain medicine) everyday.  I have literally only used it for a few times in the past 8 months!  I now also have my son buying it for his pomeranian, who also has bad back legs.  KEEP selling this product I will buy it constantly!!!!!!

  I've been supplementing with K-9 Liquid Health Glucosamine/chond with MSM for well over a year now and I know my senior dogs have a better quality of life because of it. So much so that I am also giving it preemtively to my younger dogs. It's easy to administer; I just pour it on their dry food. They've never turned up their nose at it.

  My 10 year old dog has been plagued his entire life with back and joint pain.  We had tried Rimadyl, Deramaxx and Prednisone at different intervals over the years to give him some relief.  None of which worked.  Two months in on this Liquid Health K9 Glucosamine supplement, and he is med free and pain free.  I have never seen him so energetic and enjoy walking/playing so much.  This product is the real deal.  Keep in mind it takes at least a month for the glucosamine product to "kick-in".  Also I doubled the dose for the first week.

  My vet recommended this product to us last year for our large seven-year-old dog who has developed severe arthritis due to an amputated rear leg.  The change in him is incredible.  It used to be difficult for him to stand or get up ... he would lay down to eat even.  Within a month of regularly taking this product he runs and jumps like a puppy again!  If you have a dog with a handicap or arthritis, talk to your vet about K-9 Liquid Health - it has worked miracles for us.

  


  First off - the liquid glucosamine is wonderful for my 7y old 80lb lab! He was very tender to the touch in his hips and the vet said get him on a glucosamine regimen....we've been on the Liquid Health for about a month and he has markedly less sensitivity in his hips.  I didn't realize this needs to be refrigerated when I ordered it - so plan on adding another carton to the fridge.  We poured this over food - dog is a yellow lab so he's just happy to eat! Doesn't mind the flavor one bit.
I really really wish they would rethink the carton design!! They put so much thought into the squeezy bottle-measurement thing: you shake the carton, give it a squeeze and the cup on top fills with liquid to be dispensed easily.  One problem though - YOU CAN'T SEE THROUGH THE PLASTIC! So the handy measurment hash lines on the OUTSIDE of the carton are totally useless. May seem like I'm being dramatic, but this stuff isn't cheap and doggy needs 2 tsp morning/night - so I want to make sure I dispense the right amount and don't use up the liquid faster than normal. I know I know - I can use a spoon or whatever - but why make a fancy pantsy bottle that doesn't really work?

comments: Have you ever stopped to take note of the fact that virtually every kind of toothpaste except kiddie stuff is mint flavored?  Good grief...talk about limited choices! This is the only toothpaste my daughter will use as she does not like the flavor of mint.  We looked at every tube of toothpaste in our local drug store and there was nothing else available.  If you don't like the citrus, Crest also makes a cinnamon flavor.  She doesn't like that either.  Amazon is the only place we are able to purchase this stuff, so if you've got a kid who doesn't like mint but you still need a "grown-up" toothpaste, give this a shot.
Thanks Amazon...you've saved us a LOT of grief!!!!!!

First off, I've been a long time user of P&G's Pro Health line of dental products. I wanted to give the Pro Health Clinical line a try after looking at the differences, namely a higher concentration of disinfectant. I was pleasantly surprised by this toothpaste. It has a satisfying gritty texture, a smooth mint taste, and left my mouth feeling smooth like after a dentist cleaning. I can't believe all I did was brush my teeth.
I've deducted a star off this review because the quantity is misleading. This is 8 ounces of toothpaste total, a 4x2 oz package.

I have some gum pockets, not terrible, but of concern, so I bought this thinking it could help. It's across between a paste and a gel, but more of a paste, and the flavor reminds me of the chewable pastel after-dinner mints you get at some restaurants. I find the flavor and texture pleasant (although not as pleasant as the "clean mint," which has a flavor that somehow reminds me of bubblegum). Lately, after I brush, the skin peels off the insides of my cheeks, especially toward the back. "WHOA! My mouth's in worse shape than I thought, I'd better start brushing more!" Is what I've been thinking (for weeks). But a quick Google reveals that this toothpaste is to blame. Dang it. Also, seriously? They should print that risk on the tube, it seems common enough, based on all these 1-star reviews.

Here's a nice, gross photo of a gob of cheek epithelia. You shoulda seen it when it wasn't balled up like that. It seemed to be a single layer of cells about the size of a postage stamp, all sloughed off at once in a sheet. Wish I had a microscope. Maybe I'll keep the tube so that when I get access to one I can supply a generous specimen.

(Also, it would be nice if the flavor names were a bit more descriptive, wouldn't it? I find their clean mint smoother than their smooth mint, and their smooth mint cleaner than their clean mint. But really, all I want to know before I buy a toothpaste of a certain flavor is how intense the flavor is. Give me mild mint, slightly sweet. In a different brand.)

Crest Pro-Health Clinical Gum Protection Toothpaste is my favorite toothpaste.  My dentist recommended it because my gums were starting to recede.  I prefer the soothing smooth mint over the invigorating clean mint flavor but both are good if you like mint.  I really like the tube this stuff comes in, the cap is flat so it can sit upright in my medicine cabinet and the opening is just the right size for a toothbrush.  Make sure you get the 5.8 size as the 4.0 size is too small and you will blow right through it.  It is a little on the pricey side but Crest is a name you can trust.  I was shocked to read so many negative reviews on Amazon but have not had any of the problems other users have experienced.  My advice is to give it a shot if you have poor gums and see how it goes.

comments: I could not resist posting the actual size of these bars (side by side with a US quarter).

I've recently discovered Health Warrior Chia Bars.  My first purchase was the chocolate peanut butter flavor.  Since I was new to these bars, I didn't have much grounds of comparison.  My overall thoughts on those were just OK.  I would eat the bars mainly because it was a healthy snack, not because I actually enjoyed it.  So when I ran out, I tried to by another box and found that they were sold out of the chocolate peanut butter flavor. Turns out it was a blessing!  I found these coconut flavors instead. Although, I was a bit hesitant at first to purchase these, after reading another review about how great it tastes, I took a chance.  Boy am I glad I did!  These are DELICIOUS!!  I will NEVER go back to the peanut butter again.  I highly recommend these to those who like the taste of coconut because it tastes very coconutty. So, if you're not a big fan of coconut to start with, these are probably not for you.

I was extremely excited to order these bars after reading about the health benefits of chia seeds - the Health Warrior bars looked great.  Unfortunately, I was disappointed to find how small each bar is - maybe I should have looked at the product details more closely, but it turns out that each bar is VERY small (think about half the size of a luna bar) which was disappointing.  Luckily, at only 100 calories each, the small size was not a huge deal, I just found that I wasn't entirely satisfied after just eating 1.  The taste was great, but I'm a health nut and some people might find that the Health Warrior bars are not as sweet as traditional granola bars.  I will happily eat the rest of the box but will reconsider before buying again, especially considering the price.

This product tastes good and hits the spot after exercise; however, I would not pay full price for these.  I bought them on a half price deal and that almost seems too much to pay.  They are quite small for the price.

I don't think I've ever seen so much health packed into one small, ready-to-go and easy-to-carry-around packet. (I have a couple in my glove compartment, and I've been keeping one in my briefcase too.) And I didn't see anything particularly unhealthy added (like salt, extra added sugar, unpronounceable chemicals, etc.*) I'm not an expert on the topic, but I wouldn't exactly call this an "energy bar" per se (like for "instant energy" with tons of sugar, caffeine, electrolytes, carbs, whatever). Rather I'd just call it a simple snack, something to hold you over, fill in the spaces between meals, that kind of thing. Plus, give you some healthy chia and acai!

Personally, I've had the bad habit of going all day with just one meal later in the day. I didn't realize it at the time but this put my body into a starvation mode and actually made me put on fat and gain weight, even though I was eating very little. I've been told by health and medical professionals -- and have read -- that it's best to have about five or six small meals or snacks throughout the day. So my problem has been finding GOOD, healthy snacks ... as opposed to junky snacks like Cheetos and potato chips, that kind of thing. Yes, these are a bit on the expensive side, but I'm thinking that one or two a day would be perfect.
That's my story and I'm sticking with it. Also, I'm going to order another box right now. :)
Oh yeah, I forgot to mention, d'uh ... they taste good too!

*Okay, I lied. There's apparently a tiny pinch of sea salt in there at the tail end of the ingredient list. The total sodium listed is 45 mg. I'm guessing it's part of what's needed to hold everything all together, I dunno.

Considering you can presently buy these individually at a certain national chain health/organic food store for 99 cents each, you'd be paying considerably more for 15 of them by buying this. I'm glad I caught that before I  ordered these.

With so many options, these chia bars are a great snack, nutritious, crunchy, filling and tasty. I purchased 3 flavors for my family and gave everybody the opportunity to decide which flavor they like the most. Acai berry seems to be at the top of the list, followed by coconut and chocolate. Curiously, chocolate isn't as tasty as you may think, so you may want to keep that on mind but please judge yourself.

All the ingredients are clearly marked except "natural flavors" and that is a problem. Most Americans will never realize or know what really is behind "natural flavors". Here something about it. Feel free to Google "is msg a natural flavor".
The U.S. Code of Federal Regulations describes a "natural flavorant" as:

The essential oil, oleoresin, essence or extractive, protein hydrolysate, distillate, or any product of roasting, heating or enzymolysis, which contains the flavoring constituents derived from a spice, fruit or fruit juice, vegetable or vegetable juice, edible yeast, herb, bark, bud, root, leaf or any other edible portions of a plant, meat, seafood, poultry, eggs, dairy products, or fermentation products thereof, whose primary function in food is flavoring rather than nutritional.
Within this definition and among hundreds of others substances is MSG, aspartame and are all considered "natural flavors" and "natural colors".

I have contacted the vendor to request their list of natural flavors; I'll post that information once I get it. I just hope they have not added MSG or aspartame, they last anyone should do is to feed their kids any of this highly toxic substances.

comments: I've included a video on how to test probiotics using Flora Pro-Health by Naturenetics.
Positives:
- Made in the USA!
- Packaged in individual blister packs!
- Did not require refrigeration. This would make a great product to take while traveling, keep in your purse, or even your desk drawer!
- My test concluded it had live cultures by turning in to a yogurt consistency.
Negatives:
- None!
I do not hesitate recommending this product!
This is the most incredible story of improvement in my health and  weight and if it hadn't happened to me, I'd never have believed it.
I'm in my mid 60s, have ate healthily all my life, but with the occasional indulgences eg cookies etc.

I was diagnosed 4 years ago with Parkinson's Disease and then, a year ago, my doctor told me he wanted to put me on statins for my cholesterol. Oh, and I weighed 178 lbs (I'm 5' 11" tall). So, not really overweight.
I tried statins but had such terrible cramps and diarrhea, I stopped within a few weeks and started searching for a natural alternative.
I carried out research and read a number of books in great detail. I concluded that probiotic supplementation was essential if I was to regain my health. I've not been disappointed.

The first probiotics I bought did nothing for me. Then I chanced upon Naturenetics Flora Pro-Health which I was drawn to for their high CFU count, blend of strains and unique packaging that doesn't require refrigeration. I'm glad I did, because I noticed a difference right away.
The results are astonishing. I've lost weight, my cholesterol has dropped, my digestive issues improved.
My weight has dropped from 178lbs to 162 lbs.
My LDL cholesterol has dropped from 143 mg/dL to 122, and my HDL has gone from 44mg/dL to 53. Statins are definitely not necessary.
Most surprising of all,  many of my Parkinson's symptoms have receded.
I see the probiotic supplementation as an integral part of the right approach to enjoying good health, and Flora is undoubtedly a very good product.

I needed a probiotic for candida overgrowth.  It was important to me to know for sure if the product actually had live active bacteria so as not to waste my time during an intense candida cleanse.  So I looked up online how to do an at home test by adding a few capsules to 1/2 c lukewarm milk....At the same time, just to be sure, I tested milk with nothing added and also milk with another brand of probiotic added that advertises 50 billion live cultures.  After 8 hours the yogurt like texture (curdling and liquid forming) was quite obvious in both the Flora Pro-Health and the other brand of probiotics.  Note: The other brand was not obviously better but it did curdle differently.  It had about the same amount of fluid but the fluid was distributed differently - with tiny holes interspersed throughout the milk.  The Flora Pro formed fluid around the edge of the cup.

Also, I increased the dosage after a week and a half to 2 of these per day.  I have had increased symptoms of candida die off since doing this.  (I know this is not the recommended dosage but I felt like trying it).  Experiencing the results of both of these 'tests' I can say that I feel confident that this product is quite effective.

comments: I will admit, I love having cleen teeth. I have the Sonicare diamond clean and until recently I used what I though was the best toothpaste around. I got the opportunity to sample the Crest ProHealth HD for free and loooove it! From the very first brush, I felt like I had just been to the dentist. My teeth felt smooth and I loved the minty fresh breath! My husband went in for a second kiss the first morning I used it. I also noticed my teeth continued to feel smooth all day and even after meals. I don't mind the two step system and to clarify you can SPIT after step one, but no rinsing! It really doesn't take any longer and you can really feel the difference from a one step brushing. Also, it has been 8 days and my teeth are substantially whiter! All my friends and family are asking what I have been doing because my smile looks amazing. I did knock off a star because it is a bit expensive for a toothpaste, but it's so worth it. I won't have to spend $50 on teeth whitening strips every six months and deal with the hassles of wearing them for 30 minutes a day. This is simply the easiest way to get a white smile that is truly clean and healthy.

No difference from my regular whitening toothpaste.  I used it for a couple weeks and checked with a teeth white chart before and after, no difference.  The package says 6X whiter teeth after a week versus ordinary toothpaste.  I assume they mean non-whitening, but who knows what they mean.  And 6X whiter?  Any way, it just did not help me.
The toothpaste comes in two tubes.  I followed the directions very carefully.  I used one for a minute and then tube two for a minute.  I made sure not to rinse my mouth in between.

The first tubes active ingredients are Stannous Fluoride 0.454%.  The second tube lists full ingredients of Water, Glycerin, Hydrogen Peroxide, Carbomer, Disodium Pryophosphate, Flavor, Sucralose, Sodium Hydroxide.  The whitener is just standard Hydrogen Peroxide in a gel.
After using it I feel this product is no better, nor worse than any other whitening toothpaste.

Full disclosure, I got this product free from Crest, via the Bzz marketing company, and to continue receiving products I need to submit reviews.  I doubt I will get any other Crest products after this.  Human nature is to give a better review when someone gives you something, i.e. they where nice I should be nice.  Human nature also wants to continue getting free things.  Makes me wonder about all those glowing reviews...
If you say my review is unhelpful, tell me why and I will edit the review  After all, I am trying to help people.
At first I was very skeptical.. why do I need to brush my teeth twice? This tastes kind of funny compared to the toothpaste I am used to...

I quickly overcame my skepticism after brushing.  My mouth has never felt so clean...like dentist clean (minus the painful scraping!).  I honestly didn't think it was possible for my mouth to feel this clean just from brushing my teeth.  The clean feeling (similar to the sensation of getting your braces off for the first time) lasted practically all day!  And bonus points for whitening better than any other toothpaste I've tried in the past!  Brushing my teeth with a two-step process doesn't take much more time than doing one step, and the results are incredible.  I would definitely recommend this product!
I have been using the Crest Pro Health HD system for a week. I like how it makes my teeth feel really clean. My teeth are not noticeably whiter, but to be fair, my teeth are naturally very white.

Crest sent me a free kit via BzzAgent.com, so I gave this a try. Normally, I don't pay this much for toothpaste, so if it wasn't going to work for me, I wouldn't want to plunk down that kind of money.

With my 3 cups of coffee a day habit, it's easy to understand why I would want to use a whitening product. I'm happy to say, Crest Pro Health HD kept stains away and my dental assistant complimented me on their natural looking brightness. (I have never had movie star white teeth.)
Different from other whitening toothpastes, using this product over a month caused NO sensitivity issues with teeth or gums.
Also different from sensitive teeth brand whitening toothpastes, it didn't feel chalky or leave my teeth feeling coated.

As a matter of fact, my FAVORITE aspect of using Crest Pro Health HD is the amazing "fresh from the dentist CLEAN" feeling I get each time I use it. It's that slick run-your-tongue-over-your-teeth-and-smile feeling of "Wow! Clean!"
That clean feeling even lasts through the night so that never once did I wake up with "morning breath mouth".

As far as convenience, yes, it is a two step process. But I found myself being very diligent to make sure I was brushing with each product for a full minute. If that's what it takes to get me to make sure I get 2 full minutes of brushing in--well--it worked for me!

This will be MY oral hygiene product of choice from now on. The only reason I didn't give it all stars was that I didn't experience a major whitening improvement. But, keeping stains away and giving me that clean mouth feeling that befor now, only came from paying for a dental visit twice a year, more than offsets the price.

comments:
I had braces in my mid-to-late 20s and I used to use the blue floss threaders.  I really didn't like those things very much, and it probably led to me not flossing quite as much (or as well) as I should have.  Once I got my braces off (at the ripe old age of 28!), the orthodontist glued a wire to the middle six teeth on the bottom.  So I did not escape the need to use some sort of device to floss between the teeth on the bottom.
I found these at a drugstore one day and decided to try them.  The appealed to me because there was a stiff part on the end that eliminated the need for a threader.  Plus, they incorporated Glide floss, which I had found to be my favorite (and least likely to shred on dental work) when I had braces.  Finally, they were individually wrapped (especially great if you want to travel and only bring along 2 or 3).
I'm very happy with these.  I find them much easier to use than the blue floss threaders, at least for my own personal situation.  (Sometimes I had trouble getting the blue things + floss through the places where they needed to go, but these are narrower at the stiff part so they'll fit more places.)  Definitely recommended if you have any sort of dental or orthodontic work/device that makes it difficult to use regular (non-threaded) floss.

  Excellent product.  After my braces were removed and the wires attached behind my teeth to help keep them in place I was using Oral B SuperFloss.  Despite being very careful this floss is very rough (I'm not talking about the thick part, even the thin part was very rough).  In two months I had managed to detach both wires.  The dentist recommended I use glider floss which is much more gentle.  I couldn't find it in any stores so I bought it on Amazon.  It is like switching from canvas to satin bedsheets!!  And it is much easier to pull through so I don't fear that my wires will detach again.  I would have given it 5 stars, but the only minor draw back is that occasionally it does snag/shred a bit.  Not a big deal as the micro thin shredded bit pulls out easily.  But basically this product is very near perfect.

  I have tried several brands of bridge floss. They were all difficult to use, often the stiffer part being too big for my teeth (as in a store brand I got) or did not slide smoothly between my teeth (as in Oral B). Glide is the best. It works well with a tight-fitting bridge and also works well with the rest of my mouth. I hope they keep making it for a long time.

  I've been in my braces for just over six months, and am quite thankful for this floss. It's very smooth, and gets inbetween my teeth very throughly. It's easy to use, and doesn't take that much longer than using regular floss. It gets in between my teeth very easily, and is a very important step in my oral hygiene. My dentist and orthodontist both recommend this floss. There isn't much flavour to it, of which I am glad.
I haven't had the same luck with cheaper threader floss, it just gets snagged and falls apart and ends up taking loads more time. However, I get this at the grocery store (usually Target) for about $2.50-$3. If I couldn't get this at the store though, I would still pay amazon's price for this floss (currently $5) over going with a cheaper threader floss.

  I love the product.  I feel it's a little overpriced. Then with the shipping I felt it was a rediculous price to pay.  But I cannot find them in any of the stores so the shipping was necessary to get them.  THEY ARE A GREAT PRODUCT..........I have 3 three-teeth bridges and it is a product I cannot do without.
Thanks
Cindy

  This product is by far the best for using around my bridge.  It does not fray and fits nicely in between my teeth.  I would highly recommend this product to anyone who needs to maneuver around any dental work!!

  Good product.  But, by the time you add shipping costs, could have been purchased at a local store for cheaper.

  I have braces and it takes longer for me to floss with this Glide Threader floss than a generic counterpart I've used previously.  First problem is that the threader part is too flimsy.  It bends too easily when threading under the arch wire.  Second problem is that the floss is satin.  Now that's not necessarily a bad thing but this stuff is so slick that it's almost impossible to wrap it around your fingers.  It's constantly slipping and you have to use a kung-fu death grip to keep it put.
So it's a quality product but just doesn't work well for me.

As a busy mom, I can easily get distracted because my son always needs something or household chores need to be taken care of.  My focus can get off track pretty easily.  Since I started taking Mind and Memory Brain Health, I am able to get so much work done.  I am motivated to stay on schedule for my blog work as well as everything else around our home.
I received a product to review in exchange for my honest opinion.

It is essential that my mind is clear and my body is rested so that I can make the most of my time. Lately I've been struggling with having a foggy brain. I've been sluggish and can't seem to get my ducks in a row. I've been doing silly things like putting the cheese in the pantry and leaving the house in my slippers. Since taking this supplement, I've been more clear minded, productive, and effective all the way around. I feel better about myself because I'm not making so many goofy mistakes. I'm still figuring out how to keep my life balanced, but incorporating more exercise, reducing glutenous foods, getting enough sleep, and taking this supplement has helped make so much difference. I purchased this product for a discounted rate in exchange for my honest review.

I would first like to say that I received this product at a discounted price for an honest review, however it will be honest. This is a great product that has quality ingredients in it, and tons of vitamins and minerals to help support brain function! It doesn't give you that weird feeling that some brain support supplements can, and does not use caffeine. I really like taking this product and it really does help me focus.

Cons: the only thing I could think to say is that you have to take two capsules. That's not really a con, but I know some prefer it when you only have to take one.
This is a really high quality product that I can see myself buying more of once this bottle runs out.

comments:
On a pure performance level, I LOVE this toothpaste.  It absolutely makes my mouth feel clean and fresh.  It does not foam up as much as some other toothpastes, but the effect and feel of it make this a real winner.
The downside is that I think this is priced outrageously for the amount of toothpaste you receive.  Is it worth that much more than a $3 tube of a different toothpaste?  I can't honestly say it is.  The rating gets docked for that.  If you Love this, as I do, you may want to look for the 2-pack when they come out with it.
Also, note that this comes in different sizes.  In addition to this size, it comes in a 4.2 oz size, as well as a 6 oz size in the Crest Pro-Health Collection Kit, which as yet to be released.

  I am definitely a convert to Crest Pro-Health toothpaste. It uses more fluoride than regular toothpaste and has a sort of grainy texture that does a fantastic job cleaning the teeth and keeping surface stains off. It can take a little getting used to at first as it is definitely a stronger toothpaste than the typical stuff out there, but it works extremely well. Highly recommended!

  sealed and fresh. arrived on time. teeth feel exceptionally clean. Flip top so you don't loos the cap. Able to use all of the product since it is in a tube. Extra large tube.

  I don't know why it's so hard to find a true peppermint toothpaste. I don't care for spearmint, or 'clean mint' (whatever that is), or any of the other mint variations out there so I was very happy to find this -- especially after a bad experience with Tom's of Maine peppermint toothpaste. After several weeks of using the Tom's product my teeth just never felt clean, especially at the gumline, despite using a Sonicare every day. My dentist told me many of his patients had the same experience with Tom's and that I should go back to an all-in-one paste even though my veneers mean I don't need a whitening product. I've used this for several months and have not experienced any of the problems mentioned by other reviewers. In fact, it seems to do a better job of leaving me with a fresh, clean mouth than any other toothpaste I've tried. No matter how much popcorn or garlic I've just eaten, by the time I get done with my dental cleaning routine (which starts with flossing and a water pik, followed by brushing with this paste on Sonicare's two-minute timer), my mouth feels clean and my breath is fresh. I hope this product continues to be available on Amazon for a long, long time!

  I love this toothpaste. My husband and I always have fresh breath and great check ups at the dentist. Tastes and works great!

  Always get great checkups at my dentist.  Flavor is good , but can be a little strong.  That problem is solved by putting smaller amount on toothbrush.

  I bought this toothpaste because I really like the clean feeling of peppermint and it looked very promising. The toothpaste itself is very strong and leaves my mouth feeling very clean, but after about a month of using it at least once a day, I started noticing a problem. At first, food just started tasting a little differently. Like I could no longer enjoy the taste of spicy food I used to love or eat sour things. Now, whenever I drink water it burns my mouth and throat like acid. I have discontinued using this toothpaste, and I would not recommend it to anyone. I donvt know if anyone else is experiencing this problem, but it really messed up my tastebuds.

  Great tooth paste.  Since I started using this paste I haven't had any cavities.

comments:
Used these for a couple weeks now and they seem good. I'm often told by dentists that I brush too hard, and these brush heads are very gentle. They seem to clean well but I'll update after more time (that's why I gave 4/5 stars). I was concerned about the size because I prefer compact. These are larger than Sonicare compact but smaller than standard brush heads (photo left to right is Sonicare Sensitive, Gum Health, and Compact). I will buy the Gum Health brush heads again.

  I had the older version of these when I first bought my Sonicare. These I can say with great confidence, are better than the ones that came with the toothbrush. They seem sturdier and of better quality. They were a little hard on my teeth for the first couple of brushes but they relaxed on the bristles and have been working great.

  I have a lower-end Sonicare and a higher-end Sonicare. The lower-end Sonicare came with the regular (Simply Clean?) stock brush heads, and the higher-end one came with these, which is how I discovered them. These are so much better than the stock and the sensitive brush heads if you're looking for more scrubbing. Who knows what these are doing to the enamel or my gumline, but my teeth feel cleaner.
If all you need is a basic Sonicare and don't use the fancy settings on the handle (sensitive, clean and white, etc...), get the cheapest handle, then upgrade the brush refills that are mostly interchangeable.

  This was a last-ditch effort to help the onset of Gingivitis while trying to avoid the high cost involved with seeing a specialist. After just two weeks, there was a significant increase in the health of the gums. This brush along-side a daily peroxide "swish" saved us hundreds. The dentist really thought we had been to the specialist when he saw the results!

  Same quality as the original. Make sure to buy the heads with Phillips written on them! The ones with no writing on the heads are useless knockoffs that don't fit properly and have cheap brushes. (I made this mistake myself twice on Amazon by not paying attention.)

  The goods:
- Great for sensitive gums & teeth.
The bads:
- Not cheap. You'll wind up spending more on replacement heads than the handset over the time you own it
The uglys:
- None.
